loans.name: Altanzul

texts.en:
Mr. Altanzul is 24 years old.  He is a young father who lives with his two children and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his wife both work hard and are busy during the weekdays. Altanzul is a builder and makes home furnaces through the clients' subscription. In 2008, he bought a small piece of land and built a house with questionable building materials from his fence. Now the home needs repairs and renovations, because it is very uncomfortable and built inadequately.  

The loan he is taking will be used to purchase building materials and to pay repair costs for his house, in order to have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase building materials and pay for repairs of his house for a more comfortable life.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 17 Group

texts.en: Hermawaty is part of the Usaha Jaya 17 group.  She is 30 years old and has two children. In June of 2007, she started to sell clothes by credit to her neighbours. Usually they pay Hermawati two or three times. The business is going well and she can help her husband pay for school fees. This is her second time borrowing from VF Indonesia. She has asked for 1.500.000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for Moslem clothes. Because at the end of this month is a big day, Idul Fitri, she believes she can increase her sales. In the future, she wants to open a kiosk in Pasar Koja.

loans.use: To pay for moslem clothes.

loans.name: Mark Kenneth

texts.en:
Mark Kenneth is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Mark Kenneth provides motorela or habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) services. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tools and pay for the utilities for his services.

Mark Kenneth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mark Kenneth hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the utilities for his services.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from hog raising.  Lucia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell such as noodles, soap, rice, canned goods, softdrinks, etc. for her sari-sari store business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as noodles, soap, rice, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is 58 years old and married with eight children.

Bibiana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, noodles, bread, curls, etc. for her sari-sari store.

Bibiana has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Bibiana aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like coffee, sugar, milk, canned goods, noodles, bread, curls, etc. for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Sarah has a retail shop that sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy clothes like t-shirt and blouses to sell.

Sarah is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: Din

texts.en: After taking four loans, Din is looking for a loan from HKL again as the fifth loan and the first loan from Kiva to buy more piglets for her pig hall. She is a 27-year-old woman married to Ann who is in the same age community. The main business of this family is selling the local traditional Khmer medicine to their villagers. Apart from this selling activity, Ann also earns another additional income by serving as a motor taxi driver. They have two children who are under school age. So, Din would like to request some funds in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least bachelor degrees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with two children. Alma has a retail shop that sells clothes and cosmetics. She has had this business for five years. She has asked for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional products from Natasha and Avon. Alma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional products from Natasha and Avon/

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn, 42, has three school-age children. Her occupation is raising piglets for selling. Her husband, Khan 41, sells local firewood to his neighbors. Khan has a small traditional cart for his activities in which he always faces difficulties because he must travel far away to the near mountain and forest in order to find firewood.  After a while, this family earned some money, but not enough to buy one motor to use in his selling local firewood activities. So, Sorn decided to take a loan of $400 from HKL as her second loan and the first loan from Kiva. Sorn hopes that she can afford to send her children to the university.

loans.use: to buy one motor.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
This is Bella. She is 41 and a resident of GMA, Cavite, the Philippines. She is married to Wenceslao, an agent, and is the mother of one child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.
 
Bella operates a fruit stand. She buys seasonal fruits that are native to the Philippines, such as pineapples, which are grown mostly in the south region of Luzon. She sells pineapple, banana, papaya and other Filipino fruit staples. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP. She will be using the loan to buy more fruit to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Bella dreams of being able to give her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with the other members of her fellowship group every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet every week. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of fruit for resale.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Lanh, 32, owns a business raising pigs in her pen. She is married to Phi, 33, whose main activity is selling local firewood to his villagers. They have four children, all of whom are single and live with them. Phi recently faced difficulty in his local firewood activities because his old cart was partly broken and could not be used. For this reason, Lanh decided to ask for a loan from HKL to buy a new motor for her husband to use in his selling activities. They hope that at least they can send all their children to high school.

loans.use: to buy a new motor .

loans.name: Chynarkan's Group

texts.en:
Chynarkan is the leader of this group. She is 50 and married to a hospital attendant, who is also engaged in livestock breeding. Three years ago Chynarkan bought three goats for 1500 soms and since that day the family has been breeding livestock to make additional money to meet their daily needs. With the money from this loan Chynarkan wants to buy more livestock for breeding, fattening, and resale. In the future she wants to improve the family's living conditions and wishes to build a big house for her children.

Where Did This Loan Come From?

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our lending team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Yuon

texts.en:
Yuon (in the photo) sells steamed potatoes. She steams the potatoes at home and carries them to the market to sell. Her husband, Ko, assists his wife in the business. They have three sons and one daughter. One of the children is married and lives outside the family home, one is a construction worker, one helps with parents in the business, and the last is in school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Yuon is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy a Tuk-Tuk for her son-in-law to start a business driving a Tuk-Tuk taxi.

loans.use: to buy a Tuk-Tuk for her son-in-law to start a business driving a Tuk-Tuk taxi.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Ke, 58, is a motorbike taxi driver and has three children, all of whom are married. His wife, Sophal, is 53 years old and owns a small shop selling groceries and meals for breakfast and lunch. Their children are all working in a garment factory in Phnom Penh city. Ke is looking for a loan of US $700 to buy more ingredients and local needed products for his wife's shop. His future dream is to have a bigger house and bigger shop for his wife.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for his wife's shop

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim is a weaver, and her husband is a fisherman and construction worker. They have one son and two daughters. One child is in school and other two are still young. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sim is asking for a loan of $300 to buy new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business because they are old. She will also use part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun sells vegetables and prahoc (a popular Cambodian condiment made of fermented fish paste and salt), while her husband is a rice farmer. They have been married since 1980, and have four children- two sons and two daughters. Two children are garment workers, and the other two attend school.

Phoeun is asking for a loan of $1,000 to help her farming business. She plans to purchase the neighboring farming plot to expand her farming plot, and buy a water-pump.

loans.use: To help her farming business by purchasing the neighboring farming plot to expand her farming plot, and buy a water-pump.

loans.name: Cipuncang Indah Group

texts.en: Sutini lives with her husband in Cilincing. She already has two children. In Cilincing, one way to earn a living is by selling clothes by credit. Sutini has run this business since 2010. She enjoys the business, and also helps her husband with the extra income for the family. This is her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She requests a loan of 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah to pay for more clothes to sell. She plans to have her own kiosk, and send her children to college. To fulfill this dream, she promised herself to work hard to help her husband financially.

loans.use: to pay for clothes.

loans.name: Erkingul's Group

texts.en:
Erkingul is the leader of this group. She is 51, and married to a construction worker who works in Russia. Each month he transfers his family about 7000 Soms (KGS). Erkingul has raised three sons and a daughter; the sons work in construction with their dad. Erkingul is a retiree, but she is an active person. She cultivates agricultural products, and breeds livestock for making additional money. She started this activity six years ago with an initial investment of 4000 Soms (KGS). Selling some part of the harvest, and reselling livestock after fattening, Erkingul earns an additional 3000 Soms (KGS) per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock. In the future, Erkingul plans to celebrate her grandson’s birth.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em is 56 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh city. Em's husband is often unwell, and Em has to take care of him while running a general store. 

Em earns an income by selling every-day necessities such as milk, eggs, sausages, spices, and other basic foods and goods. She began this business three years ago. Em now intends to take a loan in order to buy a greater quantity and variety of food and goods. The loan will allow her to buy snacks, cooking oil, and instant food products among other things to complement the products that she already sells. She hopes that this will meet the needs of her customers better. 

Em is hopeful that through the loan she will be able to generate a higher income and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy household necessities such as milk, eggs, and spices to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en:
Vinh is 53 years old, and married with 2 daughters. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Vinh earns a living operating a photography shop from the front of his house, which he has done for the past 15 years. His business primarily involves taking photos, developing photos, and selling photo-related items to his customers. Vinh's wife also helps him to manage the shop. 

Vinh would like to take a loan to buy better quality camera equipment and materials for his business (such as printing paper, albums, and a camera). Vinh hopes the loan will help him to provide a better service, generate more income to cover his family's living expenses, and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To buy equipment and photography materials (camera, albums, printing paper).

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru:
Нилуфар талантливая и умная женщина. Она разведена и любящая мать 2 детей. Десять лет тому назад она свой собственный женский салон красоты и успешно продолжает. Нилуфар занимается услугой корректировки бровей, губ, глаз, а также делает маникюр, педикюр, стрижка и татуаж. Когда она уехала в Москву её дочь продолжала этот бизнес. Сегодняшний день она вместе с семьёй продолжают этот бизнес и у них много постоянных клиентов. Нилуфар всегда принимает своих клиентов с радостью, и обсуживает их отлично. Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 700$ США для покупки оборудование для татуировки, которое позволяет ей корректировать бровей, губ и глаз, который популярно среди женщин. 
  
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Nilufar is a talented and smart woman. She is divorced and a loving mother of 2 children. 10 years ago she opened a beauty parlor and is very successful with her business. Nilufar offers such services as manicure, pedicure, hair styling and cosmetic corrective tattooing of brows, lips and eyes. When she was visiting Moscow, Nilufar's daughter maintained the business. Currently Nilufar and her family continue managing the beauty parlor and they have many steady clients. Nilufar always welcomes her clients with a smile and provides them with the best of service. She wants to take out a loan of 700 US dollars to purchase new tattooing equipment for correction of eyebrows, lips and eyes, which is very popular among women.

loans.use: to purchase tattooing equipment

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang (pictured above), 57, is a widow without children. She is a tailor and she is hired to put together fabric swatches. She lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Neang is asking for a loan of $1,000 to rebuild the kitchen where she cooks because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To rebuild the kitchen where she cooks because it’s old and breaks.

loans.name: Hok

texts.en: Hok is a 47-year-old widow. She is a hardworking person who is providing for her family. She is the mother of three children and has been engaged in a lotus farming and fishing for years. She lives in Baray district, Kampong Thom province, Cambodia. Her son always wakes up in the dark, early morning to go fishing and comes back at the sun-raised time. He brings fish to her and she takes them to the local market everyday. Hok would like to get a loan of $300 to purchase a small fishing boat and boat machine. In the future, she hopes that her family can live in a bigger house and that she can send her children to the university.

loans.use: to purchase a small fishing boat and boat machine.

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy (in the photo) is a mason. His wife is now a garment worker. They have been married since 1997 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family lives in a village about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. 

Vy is requesting a loan of $500 to put an addition on the house where he lives.

loans.use: To put an addition on the house where he lives.

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet, 49, is divorced and has three daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. She takes care of her children with the earnings that she makes from selling household necessities and beverages. 

Tuyet sells groceries (sugar, rice, oil, and noodles, etc.) from her general store. Her small store is located in her house. She has been working in this business for four years. Tuyet chose this type of business as it's flexible and convenient for her to look after her children while running a store. 

A challenge that Tuyet faces is that as her children grow up, the cost of covering her family's everyday expenditures has increased. Consequently, Tuyet would like to take a loan in order to buy a greater variety of groceries and basic household goods to sell from her general store and hence, increase the turnover of her business and her income.

Tuyet hopes that through the loan, her business will grow and generate a higher income, which will permit her to give her children a better life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and noodles for selling in her general store.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.en: Aida, 27, is the leader of this group. She brings up two daughters; the first daughter goes to school and the second is preschool age (under 7). In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Aida breeds cattle; her brother helps her in running the business. He resells the cattle on the cattle market, which works on Wednesday and Sunday. In this way, he earns about 5,000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for Aida to open a canteen near the university, where she prepares and sells food. Her monthly profit from this business is 7,000 soms. Aida applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase a calf for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future, she wishes to expand her business and then purchase a piece of land to start building a house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna is 32 years old, and her husband Thea is 31 years old. They live in suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers from the city. They have two children; one is in school and the other one is still young.

Vanna sells roasted beef and roasted chicken wings. Her husband is assisting her in the business. Vanna is asking for a loan of $1,000 to dig a well for her family's use, and to connect her house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.use: To dig a well for family use, and to connect her house to a private electricity utility service.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 53 year old, single, and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She supports her family through the income she earns from making clothes. 

She intends to take a loan to buy fabric, materials, and buy an overlock sewing machine to make a greater range of clothing to meet her customers' needs better. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly, and will help her to improve her living conditions. She plans to set a small part aside as savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine, fabrics, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Sineat

texts.en:
Sineat is a silk weaver, while her husband is a chef. He cooks for weddings and other ceremonies in his village and near-by villages. The have been married since 1979 and have four children; three sons and one daughter. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sineat is requesting a loan of $1,000 to continue her weaving business by purchasing weaving materials. She will use a part of the loan to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials, and buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 50 years old, and lives with her husband and two daughters in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money by buying and selling recycled waste. 

Thuy has supported her family by running a general store in front of her house for over three years. She sells daily necessities like milk, candies, snacks, washing-up liquid, and other things. She would like to expand her business to increase her income. Thuy plans to take a loan to buy basic goods such as detergent, shampoo, spices, sugar, and beverages. This will enable her to sell a greater range of goods from her general store and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy different items to sell such as detergent, shampoo, spices, sugar, and beverages.

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel is 24 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jecel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Jecel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jecel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sedep's Group

texts.en:
Sedep is the treasurer of this group. She is 40 years old, and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she brings up four children: three daughters and a son. The daughters study at school, and the son is preschool-aged. In order to earn money to meet the daily needs, the family breeds livestock and bees. If the family urgently needs money, they can sell cattle which they keep in stock. At the moment, Sedep wants to increase the number of cattle she owns, thus she applied for the loan. In the future, she wants to give her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is 51 years old, and is a married woman who has been working in the mobile phone sector for three years. She and her husband started this business to cover their expenses, and raise two daughters. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Nga is requesting a loan to use to purchase a stock of mobile phone sim cards and accessories to sell from her stall. There is a lot of demand for these products in her community, and Nga hopes that by offering a great variety of products that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

Nga hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand this business, and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy phone cards and accessories to sell.

loans.name: Tol

texts.en: Mr. Tol, age 33, has four school-age children who live as his dependents. His occupation is a farmer in Bary District, Kompong Thom Province. His wife, Mach, is 31 years old. She is a fish seller in one market not far away from her homeland. From this business, she can earn about $3 each day. Apart from these activities, Tol and his wife earn additional income by raising pigs. Presently, Tol wants to buy several pigs but lacks money. So, Tol and his wife would like to request some funds from Kiva in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least bachelor degrees for their children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for clothes.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 45 years old, and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Marilou has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy boxes of dried fish to sell.
Marilou is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beverages in bulk.

loans.name: Emerisa

texts.en:
Emerisa has a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. She sells soap, shampoo, toothpaste, biscuits and candies. She has three children to educate. While maintaining her business, she also does household chores. She usually earns about P4,000 and uses her profit as revolving capital in her retail store. Part of it also pays for daily meals and allowances for her children.

She wants to increase the capacity of sales and is asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and canned goods to sell in her store. This way, she can offer more products at her store and increase her earnings.
 
In the future, Emerisa wants to make frequent sales and earn consistent profits.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, breads, eggs and canned goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Али добросовестный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Али любит свою семью и старается, содержат свою семью в хорошей уровень жизни. Он хочет, видит своих детей в будущем образованными, честными и трудолюбивыми людьми. С этой целью он начал заниматься приготовлением лепешек. Он занимается этим бизнесом более 13 лет и у него богатый опыт. Али хотел бы получит займ для покупки муки и уголь для запасов в зимний период. Он заранее благодарен вам всем за вашу доброту!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Ali is a trustworthy and honest person. He is married and is the loving father of three children. Ali loves his family and tries to provide a decent quality of life for them. He would like to see his children grow up to be educated, honest and hard-working. With this goal, he launched a business  baking flatbread. He has been in this business for over 13 years, and has a lot of experience. He would like to receive a loan in order to purchase flour and coal, to have a supply for the winter season. He thanks all of you in advance for your kindness


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock up on flour and coal

loans.name: Petadora

texts.en:
Petadora is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Petadora has a retail shop that sells vegetables and spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional vegetables and spices to sell.

Petadora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Petadora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables & spices to sell

loans.name: Mung

texts.en:
Mung lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 39 years old and married. Her husband helps her run a general shop in front of their home. They have two sons. 

Mung's shop sells a variety of every-day household items such as shampoo, toys for kids, sugar, toothbrushes and soft drinks. They started this business two years ago and it provides the main source of income for them to cover family expenses.

Mung is requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of goods to sell in her general store, such as cooking oils, detergent, drinking water and batteries. She hopes this will assist her to better serve her existing customers and attract new customers. She hopes that through the loan she will earn a higher income, which will help her improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy cooking oils, detergent, drinking water and batteries to sell from her general store

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 41 years old and is married. Zenaida's spouse works as a local farmer. To supplement her family's income, Zenaida raises hogs and sells them to butchers in the village where they live. With the last sale, she earned P5,000 and used it for the allowances of her three children. She also bought another piglet to raise. 

She is a requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for raising her piglets and ensuring their good nutrition.

In the future, she would like to strengthen her hog raising business and soon construct a more convenient pigpen.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: The

texts.en:
The, 37, is married and earns a living to support his family by sewing and selling clothes. His wife also is involved in this business. He lives with two sons and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. 

The and his wife started the business five years ago. The would now like to take out a loan to expand the business. With the loan, he intends to buy more sewing machines, fabric and good materials that will enable him to make better quality clothes for customers. He hopes that this will generate more income and that he can save money for his children to go to school.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines, fabric and materials.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 42 years old and married with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by repairing sewing machines for customers. Hoa has been supporting her family for the past four years by sewing and selling clothes such as trousers, blouses, and t-shirts. 

Hoa is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of different fabrics and materials to sell to her customers. She hopes that this will better meet the needs of her customers and attract more customers to her store. Hoa hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income to more adequately cover family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and materials to sell to customers

loans.name: Katlyn

texts.en:
Katlyn is 27 and is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is a single mother with one child. Katlyn operates a variety store, which, in the Phillipines, is basically a small convenience store selling groceries, toiletries, and beverages in the local community. It is the neighborhood place to go pick up small quantities of shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. Katlyn buys her merchandise wholesale and sells in small quantities. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and local community members. Katlyn manages her own household while operating her business. She works hard to provide income for her family’s everyday expenses and earns a minimum of 800 PHP daily.

Katlyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She hopes to continue operating her store and expects a boost in her business income as she expands, which she hopes to do soon. Katlyn faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she studies to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and merchandise

loans.name: Sempati Utara 3 Group

texts.en:
Muniarti is married and has four children. She helps her husband to run a motorcycle repair business and sell spare parts. Their garage has been running since 2006 and is so successful that Muniarti and her husband are looking for a larger space since they have many customers.

Muniarti is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 IDR to buy an air compressor. She hopes that the profit from her loan will allow her and her husband to continuously send their children to school through college.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 46 and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ronildo, who is a farmer, and the mother of two children, both of whom are in high school. Together with her husband, Marilyn manages her household. She also operates an ornamental plant business and works hard to continually provide income for her family’s everyday expenses. Marilyn grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines, such as ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and she also grows a variety of hanging plants. Her regular customers are tourists, neighbors, and nearby community members.  Marilyn earns a minimum of 300 PHP daily.

Marilyn is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs to help continue operating her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands. Marilyn dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God. 


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. Groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and garden inputs

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband sells charcoal for cooking and Hong takes care of her family. She also earns an income from selling food, such as noodles, at a food stall in the local community. Hong has run her food stall for nearly two years. 

Hong is requesting a loan to purchase a wider range and greater quantity of ingredients to make food. She hopes that her loan will increase her income, allow her to invest in her business, and enable her to save for family emergencies.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and food to sell

loans.name: Sayeramo

texts.ru: Сайёрамо проживает в городе Куляб. Ей 32 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Более четырех лет она занимается торговлей у себя дома. В основном Сайёрамо продает детскую одежду. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды и обуви.
texts.en: Sayeramo lives in the town of Kulob. She is 32 years old. She is divorced and has two children. She has secondary education. She does business by selling from home for more than four years. Sayeramo mainly sells children's clothing. She is taking out the loan to buy children's clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing and shoes

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 52, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Narciso, a farmer, and mother of two children; both are already working. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Nida operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias, and also a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP)  in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Nida dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week  and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs needed in her business.

loans.name: Ibrahim M.

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Ibrahim.  He is married and has one child aged three. In 2004, Ibrahim began his assorted goods business selling sardines, soap, batteries, razors, tooth paste, etc. He took over his business from his eldest sister who has relocated to the United States of America.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 750,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000.  

Ibrahim has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy different items -batteries (3 cartons @ Le140, 000), Grafton Drinking Water (40 bundles @ Le3000), soft drinks (150 crates @ Le15,000), candles (10 cartons @ Le50,000), torch lights (1 carton @ Le200,000), toilet soap (1 carton @ Le150,000) and foam surf (cartons @ Le60,000). 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 200,000. In the future, Ibrahim plans to buy both a taxi and a motorcycle and build a house for his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for various goods to stock his store.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 46, is a woman who is trying to improve her family's quality of life. She lives with her husband and two children in Ho Chi Minh city. Anh supports her family by running a general store from her home. Her husband earns an income repairing motorbikes for customers. 

Anh has been running a general store for four years. She buys items from wholesalers and then sells the items to people in her community. The items she sells include beverages, fruit juice and household necessities. 

Anh would like to take out a loan to increase the size of her business by purchasing beverages in bulk at lower prices, which will enable her to offer more competitive prices and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that will help her to improve her living conditions and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy beverages to stock her general store.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo, 44, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Sencia, a housewife and mother to their three children – two are already in grade school. Rodolfo, together with his wife and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support his children’s schooling. 

Rodolfo operates a "rolling store". In the Philippines, a rolling store is basically a small mobile store, which retails small kitchen & plastic wares, toiletries and plastic toys to the local neighborhood. Rodolfo earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of product items to expand his inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Rodolfo hopes to be able to expand soon, just as he fervently hopes that his children will be able to finish their studies and graduate one day. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional products and items needed in his business.

loans.name: Anabella

texts.en:
Anabella is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Anabella has a shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Anabella is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anabella hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru:
Искандар добросовестный и честный человек.  Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и воспитывает своих детей.  Когда у него родился ребенок он начал думать, что у него расходы вырастут. Он решил, что приготовление блюд выгодно ему, чтобы зарабатывать на жизнь. Более 4 лет он занимается этим бизнесом с помощью своего брата. Он хочет, чтобы его дети ходили в хороших детских садиках и учились в престижную школу. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Искандар хотел бы получит займ в размере 1500$ США для покупки продукты питание для запаса. Он надеется, то кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Iskandar is a trustworthy and honest person. He is married and the loving father of two children. His wife is a homemaker and raises their children. When Iskandar’s first child was born, he realized that his expenses will go up. He decided that cooking food for sale is a profitable way to support his family. He has been in this business for over four years, with his brother’s help. He would like his children to attend a good kindergarten and then go to a prestigious school. He would like to expand his business and maximize his profit. Iskandar would like to obtain a loan of 1500 USD in order to stock up on groceries. He hopes that lenders will support him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock up on groceries

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul is the leader of this group. She is 25 and married to a builder. Together with her husband she is bringing up a daughter and a son who are both preschool age. 

In order to earn money to meet the family's needs Ainagul breeds livestock. With the profits gained from reselling livestock she was able to purchase household appliances. With money received from the loan Ainagul wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. In the future she wants to give her children a good education. 

---Where Did This Loan Come From?---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team-Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Epifania has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Epifania is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Epifania hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong, 42, is a married man with two daughters and one son. He lives with his wife and children in Ho Chi Minh city. Cuong and his wife have been involved in the business of selling household necessities in front of their house for 5 years. 

Cuong would like to get a loan to expand his business by buying a larger variety of items such as stationery, notebooks, and sanitation products to offer to his customers. 

He hopes that through the loan he will be able to generate a higher income, which will enable him improve his family's living conditions and save money for the education of his children.

loans.use: To buy stationery, notebooks, and sanitation products to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Gaudiosa

texts.en:
Gaudiosa is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Gaudiosa has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Gaudiosa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gaudiosa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Melanie has a retail shop that sells fish like milk fish & tilapia. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. 

Melanie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Melanie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 43 years old and married. Her husband is a motorbike driver for hire and also helps her to run a general shop in front of their door. They have a daughter and a son. 

Hong's shop sells many kinds of products such as shampoo, toothbrushes, noodles, confectioneries and soft drinks. She started this business 6 years ago and it provides the main source of income for her family.

Hong is requesting a loan to purchase a greater quantity and variety of basic goods, such as snack foods and beverages, to stock her store. She hopes that will enable her to increase the turnover of her business and help her to improve her living conditions and set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, toothbrushes, noodles, confectioneries, and soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 31 years old and married with three children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as biscuits, detergent, and other miscellaneous items.

Cheryl has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Cheryl aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as biscuits, detergent, and other miscellaneous items

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 48 years old and married with three children.

Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Vilma has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and earns additional income from raising chickens.

Vilma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Mabinty. She is married to a tailor and has five children aged 4, 7, 11, 16, and 19. She has three additional dependents, who live with her because she is living in the city where educational facilities are much more improved than the villages where their parents live. 

In 2004, Mabinty established her clothing business. She began her business because she needed a source of income to help her husband support their home. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,050,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Mabinty has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy one bale of wax cotton @ Le1,800,000, 50 pieces of different types of jeans @ Le45,000,pay transportation and taxes . 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000. In the future, Mabinty plans to open a big shop and build a dwelling house for her family and make sure her children go through university. 

She serves customers around the city and the surrounding villages. She normally buys her goods from Freetown and Guinea. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted wax cotton - one bale of wax cotton @ Le1,800,000 , 50 pieces of different types of jeans @ Le45,000. transportation and taxes

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has two children. 

Romulo has a shop that sells a variety of vegetables & spices. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy vegetables & spices for resale. 

Romulo is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Romulo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices for resale

loans.name: Dormelita

texts.en:
Dormelita is 68 years old and married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Dormelita has a fishing business in the Philippines. Dormelita requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

Dormelita has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Dormelita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Truc

texts.en:
Truc, 43 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Truc's husband is a worker in a local factory. She supports her family by selling rice from her house. 

Truc requires a loan to buy more kinds of rice to expand her business and increase her sales. 

Truc hopes that her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of rice to sell.

loans.name: Manggar Indah 2 Group

texts.en:
Lina is a mother of four children. She is 38 years old. She lives in Cilincing with her family. 

Starting in 2009, she has been producing Lontong (a rice-based dish) and cookies and selling them in front of the elementary school Al Khariyah to help her husband acquire school fees for their children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Indonesia. She is asking for 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah. With this money she wants to buy a table and chair, and to buy more ingredients for her Lontong and cookies. In the future, she wants to add more to her menu.

loans.use: to pay for a table, a chair, and more ingredients

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат. У него один ребенок. Он имеет среднее образование. Хусейн предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже четыре года. Кредит берет для приобретения автомашины. Хусейн хочет продать свою машину, чтобы купить новую автомашину другой марки.
texts.en: Huseyn lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 30 years old, married and has one child. He has secondary education. Huseyn provides taxi services. He has been in this business for four years. He is taking out the loan to buy a car. Huseyn wants to sell his car and buy a new one of a different mark.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 33 years old and married with one child.

She earns her living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Juditha is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Juditha has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from her buy and sell of livestock business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Genniper

texts.en:
Genniper is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Genniper has a retail shop that sells vegetables & spices. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables & spices to sell.

Genniper is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Genniper hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables & spices for sale.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Rufina has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from her general store.

Rufina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta works hard to support her family.  Julieta is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her motorcycle sidecar.

Julieta has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Julieta would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair of her motorcycle sidecar

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has been in the tailoring business for 21 years. 

Merlita is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her tailoring business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Maribeth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Maribeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Maribeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, a married 42-year-old mother of  five children, four of whom are in school, is a very hardworking vegetable vendor in the Philippines. In business for 15 years, she is requesting a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Darlinda

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Darlinda.  She is married to a welder and has three children aged 1, 7 and 10 years. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because she helps to them with their education. 

 In 2009, Darlinda established her clothing and plastic slippers business. She began her business because she had dropped out of school. She joined her mother in business until she was able to start her own business. She makes good profit and she is glad to be a self-employed woman.  

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1,300,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000.   Darlinda requires a loan in order to buy wax cotton - 2 bales @ Le2,000,000 and 5 bundles of plastic slippers @ Le200,000 for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 250,000.  

In the future, Darlinda plans to build her own house, become an international businesswoman and support her children through their education.  Darlinda always travels to Guinea Conakry to get her goods twice a month. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for wax cotton - 2 bales @ Le2,000,000 and 5 bundles of plastic slippers @ Le200,000.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is 45 years old and married with three children.

Leonida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

Leonida has taken out and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns extra income from raising pigs.

Leonida aspires to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Anna Liza

texts.en:
Anna Liza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Anna Liza has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Anna Liza is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anna Liza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Denia is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins.

Denia has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from her coffee shop and food vending businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
Basilia is a determined person and she wants to improve her fish selling business. In the village where she lives, she had numerous competitors in fish vending but according to her, she makes more customers and meets their demand for high quality fish, affordable prices and friendly services.

Basilia is 44 years old and single. She adopted a child whom she is sending to school.

She needs additional capital and that is why she is taking out a loan of P17,000 to buy fish such as milk fish, mud and catfish and chickens to dress and sell in front of her house. In this way she hopes to increase the capacity of sales from her business and boost her profit.

In the future, Basilia would like to obtain enough income to support her adopted child's education. She also wants to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fish and chickens to dress and sell in front of her house.

loans.name: Christie

texts.en:
Christie is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Christie has a retail shop that sells spices and vegetables. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables and spices tor sell.

Christie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Christie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 62 years old and married with seven children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Violeta has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She has been running the sari-sari store for 15 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Violeta aspires to save enough money in order to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Ek

texts.en:
Mrs. Ek is a widow. She is a 38 years old and has four children. Three of them are attending school and live under her roof but another son is working as a garment factory worker in Phnom Penh city where he can earn a suitable salary per month. Presently, her occupation is farming in Bary District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. 

Apart from her farming activity, Ek also earns additional income by raising pigs. Ek wants to buy several pigs, but she lacks money.  So Ek decided to request some funds from Kiva in order to purchase piglets. Her future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least a Bachelor's degree for her children.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married.  With two children in school, Alicia works very hard to provide for them.

Alicia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Alicia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, etc.

In the future Alicia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has three children.
 
Josephine has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Josephine is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Villaluz

texts.en:
Villaluz is 47 years old and a widow with three children.

Villaluz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Villaluz has borrowed and paid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from her shell buying and selling business.

Villaluz aspires to save enough money so she can provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marebeth

texts.en:
Marebeth is 38 years old and married. She has two children.

Marebeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, groceries, etc. 

Marebeth has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Marebeth aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mayonita

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Mayonita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Mayonita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her fishing boat.

Mayonita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for the repair and maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane believes that "poverty is not a hindrance to success." 

Although she belongs to a poor family, she says that through patience and hard work, they can survive. She says that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and determination.

To earn income, she enjoys selling snacks and meals in front of the school campus. She wakes up early in the morning to prepare the foods that she sells to her customers. She endures hardships and problems for she has the confidence to pursue the business. She has been in this business for almost 15 years, and all her three children are already graduated from college. 

At age 53, she aims to pursue and improve the business, for she wants to earn a higher income to save for future emergencies and to improve their house to live more comfortably. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 23,000 to buy pork, vegetables, flour and raw ingredients to be cooked and sold in her food stall. 

She is hoping that the loan will help her to improve and expand the business someday.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables, flour and raw ingredients to be cooked and sold in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for materials to make gado-gado and juice.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Elsa has a food shop or eatery that sells viands like afritada and caldereta (popular stews). She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and other dishes.

Elsa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making viands and other dishes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 32-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in a bar and bakery business for eight years and he got the initial capital to start his current businesses from farming. 

His hardships are bad debtors and price fluctuations, and his vision is to improve the quality of products in the bakery and to educate his family.

Peter needs the loan facility to buy raw materials for baking bread.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for baking bread.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a machine shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her machine shop business.

Warlita has been in this business for four years. Warlita earns additional income from buying and selling fire wood.

Warlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional materials for her machine shop.

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Avelina, who is 57 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with three children.

She helps her husband in tilling their farm for a living. They have been doing it for over 30 years and earning the average of PHP 7,000 each cropping. Avelina works hard to increase their income every harvest in order to improve her family's life.

Avelina wants to live a better life with her family, and that’s why she is helping her husband in growing their crops. However, due to lack of farming capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Alma has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Alma is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Makoti

texts.en:
Makoti is a 22-year-old hard-working man, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been selling motorcycle spare parts for two years, and with the proceeds, he has been able to build a house and also support his parents. 

His hardship is accidents at work, and his vision is a big garage plus a good residential house.

Makoti intends to use the loan to buy motorcycle spare parts for resale.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Kev

texts.en:
Mrs. Kev is an old mother of three children. Two of her children are school-aged, and another daughter is working as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh city where she can earn enough money. Currently, Kev is a farmer in Baray District, Kompong Thom Province, Cambodia. Her husband is also a farmer. From farming, she can earn about $2 each day.

Apart from this business, Kev and her husband also earn additional income by raising pigs. Kev wants to purchase some pigs but lacks the money.
