So, Kev and her husband would like to request some funds from Kiva in order to purchase piglets. Their future expectation is to have a bigger business, bigger house, and at least a bachelor's degree for their children. Kev said that she is very thankful to all lenders that help her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Мамлакат  честная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 5 детей. Её муж является трудовой мигрантом в России. Более 8 лет Мамлакат занимается купля продажей детской одежды и у неё богатый опыт. Она хорошо знает в узкие стороны своего бизнеса. Она мечтает о том, что когда то она расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальной прибыли. Мамлакат хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она хотела бы получит кредит в размере 3000$ США для покупки подростковой школьной одежды. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mamlakat is an honest and trustworthy person. She is married and the loving mother of five. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. For over eight years, Mamlakat has been working as a reseller of children’s clothing, and so she has a lot of experience. She knows all about the finer aspects of her business. Her goal is to expand her business one day and eventually to maximize her profits. Mamlakat would like to expand her business. She would like to obtain a loan of 3,000 USD in order to stock up on school uniform for teenagers. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to stock up on school uniform for teenagers.

loans.name: Gegie

texts.en:
Gegie is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children.
 
Gegie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gegie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Gegie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rolita

texts.en:
Rolita is 50 years old and married with three school-aged children. Two of her children are in college and need more financial support due to the high cost of school fees. To supplement her husband’s income, Rolita operates a business selling frozen food in her village. 

Rolita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy products such as hotdogs, bacon, ham, and longanisa (pork sausage) to sell. Her goal is to improve her business to earn a higher income to sustain her family's needs. Despite the hardships of life, Rolita hopes that she will expand her business through hard work and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy meat products to sell

loans.name: Chances Group

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Kudakwashe from Gweru, the capital of Midlands Province in Zimbabwe. He is married to a teacher and together they have two children, one attending school.  

Kudakwashe runs a food business selling farm produce and chickens. The business has been in operation for two years. He says the main challenge he faces is transportation of products to market. 

Kudakwashe has requested a loan of $400 to buy chickens and chicken feed. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to help sustain the family. In the future Kudakwashe plans to own and run a butchery.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Warnanto

texts.en:
Warnanto is 37 years old and has three children. He is pictured here with his wife. Since 2005, he has been selling mussels to support his family. He takes his cart through the neighborhood of Kelapa Gading to sell his wares. 

Warnanto is requesting a 10,000,000 IDR loan to buy an additional cart and more mussels to expand his business. This will be Warnanto’s third loan cycle with VisionFund Indonesia.

loans.use: to buy mussels and a new cart

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 21 years old and single. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and earns a living making and selling milk tea, a popular drink in her community. Trang has run this business in front of her house for two years. 

Trang is requesting a loan to replace her old furniture with new furniture to attract more customers to her shop. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to generate more profit to support her family as well as save additional money to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her tea shop

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 47 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a business buying and selling herbal medicine in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Marilyn is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional herbal medicine to sell. In the future, Marilyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase herbal medicine to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past seven years and earns additional income from selling charcoal. Rose has been sustaining her business through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Rose is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 58 years old and married with three children. For the past 17 years, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she earns additional income from buying and selling herbal products and farming sugarcane. Lita has borrowed and repaid 16 previous loans from NWTF.

Lita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her store. She works hard to provide for her family and hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 31-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. For the past seven years, he has been selling clothes. Moses got the capital to start his business from coffee trading and his greatest business hardship is inadequate capital.

Moses is requesting a loan to buy clothing and shoes to sell. In the future, he hopes to have a big shop and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 49 years old and married with three children. She earns a living farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Zeny has been a sugarcane farmer for the past six years. 

Zeny is requesting a 28,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream: to build and expand her business and secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 35 years old and married. She has six children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells spare parts in the Philippines.  She has been buying and selling spare parts for 12 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of spare parts to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan.

Jocelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo is 47 years old and a father with four children, three of whom are in school. He runs a “sari-sari” store. Sari-sari is a Tagalong word that means variety. Gerardo sells canned goods, powdered soap, and soy sauce. He also works as a daily farmhand to earn additional income for his family. 

Gerardo is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to expand the size of his store. He will use the loan to buy hollow blocks and cement that he needs for the renovation. He will also buy additional merchandise, such as bread, for his store. Gerardo believes that his loan is a big factor in generating higher income. He plans to buy himself hearing aids to provide better customer service. Gerardo works hard to achieve his goal of sending all of children through school to someday finish their education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to renovate his store and buy store merchandise

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in carpentry and the timber business for four years. He started with a capital of 300,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings. His hardship is lack of enough capital to meet the demand and  his vision is having a modern showroom plus educating his children.

Semu needs the loan to buy timber and already made furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy timber and   already made furniture to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 57 years old and married. She has four children.

Eunice works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling cellphone accessories in the Philippines. She has been running the business for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling fruits. 

She has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Eunice has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Eunice aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 66 years old and married. She has three children.

Sonia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice. 

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as shampoo and groceries.

Sonia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Sonia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy, age 47, is a married woman who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. One of her children is married and lives in a separate house, and the other two are attending school. 

To make a living, Mrs. Tuy has run a small business by selling some fresh fish which she gets from her husband fishing and also buy from other domestic fisherman in low price.   
From this business activity, the humble couple can earn around $4 per day to use in the daily expenses. Mrs. Tuy will be using a loan to purchase some plank for construction a new wooden house. With this loan, Mrs. Tuy said that she is very grateful to all lenders that support her family so she can use some loan fund to add with her current saving to build a new house.

For her future plan, She will buy a new boat to assist her husband business, to purchase build a bigger house and the most important thing, Mrs. Tuy hopes to use most of her income to support her children to finish at least high school level.

loans.use: to purchase some plank for construction a new wooden house.

loans.name: Febelyn

texts.en:
"Success is always at the end of every sacrifice" is a guiding principle of Febelyn, a 41-year-old mother who has three school-aged children. Sometimes, they have experienced financial difficulty due to low crop production and the high cost of commodities. 

In this regard, Febelyn wants to help her husband in earning income to sustain their family needs. She engages in load retailing while she takes care of her small baby. Through patience and sacrifices, she earns a profit of P4,000 a month. 

She wants to improve the business to earn a higher income to cope with all their needs and finance the school fees of their children.  She is asking for a loan of P8,000 to buy load "wallet" for her cell phone for load retailing. She hopes that the loan will help a lot to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy load "wallet" for her cell phone for load retailing.

loans.name: Myriam

texts.en:
Miriam is 29 years old, a mother of three children. She finished college but could not find a better job so she decided to build up a business.  She is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and she sells candies, canned goods, powdered soap and breads. She usually gets here all the expenses to finance their daily needs. 


She is requesting a loan amount P10,000 to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, vinegar and detergent to sell in her store. The people in their community are always looking for those goods and that’s why she wants to have stocks of these goods.

She hopes that her business will get over the "humps" so that she can provide for all the needs of her school-aged children and let them finish all their desired courses someday.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, soy sauce, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 57 years old and married. She has seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Azucena has been raising pigs for 25 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

Azucena is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Manggar Baru Group

texts.en:
Karsinah is 37 years old. She has two children. Now her family is supported only by her husband, who works as a laborer in a factory. 

She wants to help her husband to gain more money. This is her first time borrowing from VisionFund Indonesia. She asks 1,000,000 Indonesian Rupiahs to start selling side dishes. 

She hopes her business will go well and they can support their children. 

In the future she wants to have a house in her home town and live happily while she grows old.

loans.use: to start a business selling side dishes.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 56 years old and married with five children. For the past 15 years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income buying and selling rice. Nenita works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid 11 previous loans from NWTF.

Nenita is requesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of products such as shampoo, groceries, and other items for her sari-sari store. Nenita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 38 years old and married with three children. For the past two years, she has been running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and she also earns an income selling food. Fe works hard to support her family and has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF.

Fe is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy merchandise to sell such as shampoo, groceries, and other items in her sari-sari store. She aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring and dressmaking business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past 10 years and also earns an income from laminating wood. Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.

Judith is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional linens and other materials for her business. In the future, she dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase linens and materials for her business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 44 years old and married with eight children. She lives in the Philippines. For the past three years, Letecia has been a rice farmer and she also earns an income from running a general store. 

Letecia is reqesting a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita has two children and one of them is attending school. Pacita is widowed and 63 years old, but she can still work hard. 

She doesn't want to laze at home that is why she opened up a sari-sari (variety) store in front of her house. After doing her home chores, she manages her store and makes lists of groceries needed. This occupies her daily schedule. From this activity, she generates income from every retail item she sells. She has been engaged in this business for almost one year, and she now earns PHP 300 a day. She uses it for the family's daily consumption and for her child's education and allowance.

Pacita would like to keep improving her business. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store. With these grocery items, she will increase the volume of sales from her business. 

Pacita hopes to see her small store grow into a bigger one.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, eggs, breads, soap, and shampoo to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Elva Teresa

texts.es: Elva  tiene 55 años, es viuda dese hace 20 años y en la actualidad vive con el menor D. sus 6 hijos. DesD. su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, siembra algunas hortalizas verduras pero principalmente la papa y el maíz que es lo que mas venD. después D. cosechar, su dedicación es diaria pero por el paso D. los años también ha visto que es mas rentable la compra y venta D. animales  que constantemente realiza durante 5 años mientras espera el tiempo D. la cosecha, venD. los fines D. semana en la feria ganadera y lo que no llega a vender lo lleva a su establo que tiene para su propio consumo,  durante estos  años D. trabajo ha visto que la venta D. animales tiene menores riesgos y mayores ganancias por lo que su deseo es incrementar su capital D. trabajo.  Es su octavo crédito con MFP,  le recomendaron trabajar con prestamos que le beneficien en cada inversión que realiza en el campo como en la venta D. animales y desD. entonces le es muy necesario tener un apoyo financiero en cada proyecto que se proponga concretar. En esta ocasión su dinero estar destinado a la compra D. mas mercadería en animales porque en esta temporada D. festividades llamadas Santiago  es la mas rentable en ventas.
texts.en: Elva is 55 years old and she was widowed 20 years ago. She currently lives with the youngest of her 6 children. Since she was a girl she has always been involved in agriculture. She plants a few vegetables but primarily she cultivates potatoes and corn, which produce the best selling harvest. She works every day but with the passage of the years she has also seen that it is more profitable to buy and sell livestock. This has been a business that she has had for the past 5 years, while she waits for the harvest to be ready. She sells on the weekends at the farmers fair. Whatever she doesn't sell she takes back to her stable and she uses for her own consumption. During these years of work she has seen that the sale of livestock runs fewer risks and earns greater profits. Therefore her goal is to increase her working capital. This is her eighth loan with MPF (Kiva Field Partner). She started out following a recommendation to work with loans so that she will profit from each investment that she makes in the field of livestock sales. Since then she has seen the great importance of having financial support in each project she sets herself out to do. At this opportunity the funds will be used to purchase more livestock because it is during this festive season of Santiago that the sales are most profitable.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to take advantage of the festive season of Santiago.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and is married with three children. For the past 20 years, she has earned a living buying and selling farm equipment and supplies in the Philippines. She earns additional income vending food.

Marilyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional farm supplies and equipment. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 48 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее сын рабтает кредитным офицером в микрафинасовой организации. Сама Мавлуда имеет высшее образование. Она занимается торговлей. У нее имеется магазин, где она продает продукты питания. В этой области она работает 15 лет. Кроме того сейчас Мавлуда у себя дома строит магазин. Она берет кредит для покупки продуктов питания и приобретения холодильника, чтобы продавать молочные продукты.
texts.en: Mavluda lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 48 years old, married and has three children. Her son is a credit official at a micro-financing organization. Mavluda herself has a bachelors degree and currently works in retail: she owns a grocery store and has managed it for 15 years. Currently Mavluda is remodeling her house to open another store. She is taking out this loan to purchase additional groceries in bulk as well as a fridge so that she can sell milk and dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase bulk groceries and a refrigerator

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Daisy has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Daisy is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Femibc Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 51-year-old Fatima from Gweru. She is widowed with six children. She also cares for one dependent. Fatima runs a retail business selling poultry and fabric. She employs two people. The business has been in operation for 30 years. She says the main challenge faced is a lack of working capital. 

Fatima has requested a loan of $400 to buy chickens, chicken feed, and fowl run materials. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to help sustain her family. In the future, Fatima plans to expand her business and increase profitability.

loans.use: To buy chickens, chicken feed and fowl run materials

loans.name: Génèse Plus Group

texts.en:
Génèse Plus ("Génèse" means "Genesis" in English) is a community bank chaired by Isabelle. It is composed of 11 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Génèse Plus is in Lubumbashi, which is a city located in Southeast of the Democratic Republic of Congo. Lubumbashi was not spared the crisis and multiple wars that hit the DRC during the '90s decade. It is from the 2000s until today that the informal sector took off.
 
Isabelle is a dressmaker. She has been part of the microbusiness world since 2000. She started her business by selling palm oil and stopped it because of transportation difficulties. Today, she operates her sewing workshop downtown Lubumbashi. Besides sewing, she also sells second-hand clothing. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC, and she has already received eight loans and has repaid them correctly. 

She intends with the next loan to increase the inventory of her businesses by purchasing a second-hand clothing bundle as well as supplies such as lining, fabric and zippers for her sewing business in order to increase her profit. 

Currently, her businesses bring in a profit of US $105 every week. Isabelle is 52 years old, married and the mother of eight children. Four of them attend school. Her dream is to open a sewing item store in her environment. She is very happy to be MFI HOPE’s client.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her businesses by purchasing a second-hand clothing bundle as well as supplies for her sewing business.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Jean has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Jean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 35 years old, married and has two school-age children. He operates a motorcycle transport business in his village to earn income for his family. He has been in this business for almost 20 years, earning a net profit of 7,000 PHP a month. 

Rodrigo aims to strengthen his business to have a stable source of income for the sake of his family. He is asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy gasoline and spare parts for the motorcycle in order to provide a better service. Despite hardships and difficulties, he is still hoping that someday he can achieve his business goal through his patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Be

texts.en:
Be is 40 years old. She has two daughters and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Be's husband works as a tailor. Be also earns an income to support her family by sewing clothes at her house.

Be has requested a loan to invest in their businesses by buying better quality fabrics and clothing materials to sell. She hopes that this will enable them to better serve their current customers, attract new customers, and increase the turnover of their businesses. Be hopes their businesses run smoothly and will help her family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fabrics and clothing materials to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Mary Ann has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Mary Ann is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Experia

texts.en:
Experia is 59 years old and a widow with 8 children.

Experia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retailing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Experia has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retailing business for 15 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and a general store.

Experia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn, 42 years old, is a security guard’s wife. Her husband's income every month is not enough to maintain their daily needs, so she ventures in the rice business. She has been doing this for five years. She is happy that now, the business is gradually improving. 

She was blessed with five children and is doing her best to continue to send them to school with help of her rice business activity. She wants her children to finish college for their future welfare. 

To further grow her venture, she is requesting a loan amount of 25,000 pesos to buy rice and materials such as hollow blocks and cement for the renovation of her business stall, where she stores sacks of rice for future sale. 

Jocelyn hopes to earn bigger income from her business to extend financial help to her nephews, who are out of school at the moment. She hopes that ASKI, Kiva's partner, will always be generous and helpful in reaching her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy rice and materials such as hollow blocks and cement for the renovation of her business stall.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 22 years old and blessed with four children ages 4, 3, 2 and 7 months old. She finished her high school education. Her parents can’t afford to send her in college, that is why she was engaged into early marriage. She is hoping to educate all her children. Marilou strives hard to sustain their needs. She raises hogs and sells them in order to generate income. Sometimes, she also helps her husband in his farming business.

Marilou is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy hog feeds to ensure good nutrition.

She hopes to develop her hog-raising business to generate more income and save for future expenses.

Someday, she also wants to provide a progressive living for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds.

loans.name: Junelyn

texts.en:
Junelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Junelyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Junelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Junelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mee Group

texts.en:
From Gweru, the capital of Midlands Province in Zimbabwe, Elita runs a general dealership and flea market stall. She has requested a loan of $400 to buy groceries, clothing and footwear.

To this point Elita has managed to meet orders and demand, but the loan will help her to grow her business capacity. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will provide her with more disposable income and an improved standard of living for the family. She will also be able to pay her dependents' school fees.

In the future Elita sees herself being successful and owning her own shop and perhaps even buying a car.

loans.use: to buy wares for her flea market stall and general store.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep is 52 years of age, married, and lives with his wife and son in Ho Chi Minh City. He runs a general store to earn income to support his family. He sells basic items such as candy, cigarettes, shampoo, insecticide, and beverages. He has been in the business for more than seven years. 

Hiep is requesting a loan to invest in his business by buying a greater quantity and variety of basic goods to sell in his general store. He hopes that this will enable him to better serve his current customers, attract new customers, and increase the turnover of his business. Hiep hopes his business runs smoothly and will help his family to increase their income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy products such as candy, shampoo, insecticide, and beverages to sell in his general store.

loans.name: Kanymbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kanymbubu is the leader of this group. She is 57 years old and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she has raised three daughters and four sons. All the children except the youngest son are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money to meet daily needs, the family cultivates clover and breeds livestock animals. Kanymbubu is requesting a loan because she needs additional financial funds to purchase sheep. She wants to purchase four sheep to increase the number of livestock. In the future, Kanymbubu wishes to build a house for her younger son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for the flea market.

loans.name: Genecita

texts.en:
Genecita is 39 year old widow with 1 child.

Genecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a used clothing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Genecita has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the used clothing business for 6 years and also earns an income from a sari-sari store.

Genecita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is married to a small farmer and has a child. She is 22 years of age and has been engaged in the farming business for five years. She is helping her husband to manage their farming business (their primary source of income) because she wants to provide all the needs of her child, especially in financial matters. She doesn’t want child to feel what she experienced.

Joylyn is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to pay for land tax and to purchase fertilizers to use in farming. With the help of this loan, she ensures an additional yield for her family. She looks forward to the increase in her P10,000 net income every cropping season, which is usually during April and November.

loans.use: to pay for land tax and purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Jehazeel

texts.en:
Jehazeel is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jehazeel has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Jehazeel is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jehazeel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Daniel has a business of a small retail shop that sells sugar and salt, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Daniel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Daniel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his business.  Daniel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his capital

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like soap and salt for resale.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom supports her family financially by doing embroidery. She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. 

Her husband is a professional carpenter and expert in making furniture. He operates his business in the market and manufactures very good quality  furniture. Due to his good quality work, he receives good appreciation from his customers. 

Kalsoom is the mother of seven children. Two elder sons work in a factory while others support their mother in her embroidery work. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because she wants to buy embroidery material in bulk to be able to fulfill larger orders on time. This will help her make more income every month. 

She has been operating her business for the past 10 years and is confident that an investment will help her improve her business. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous year, she has established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material in bulk

loans.name: Chemanai Group

texts.en: Emily is 49 years old and lives in Gweru. She is widowed with five children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. She is fortunate to benefit from financial support from her older children.  Emily runs a hair salon. The business has been in operation for 7 years. She says the main challenge faced is lack of sufficient working capital. Emily has requested a loan of $400 to buy hair products such as weaves. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to expand her business. In the future, Emily plans to have a fully operational boutique.

loans.use: to buy weaves for the salon

loans.name: Amisi

texts.en:
Amisi is 50 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has twelve children, with three of them currently in school.

Amisi is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. For the past ten years Amisi has had a catering business. To expand his business, Amisi is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC to purchase warming dishes. Amisi hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his children.

In the future, Amisi hopes to buy another car which will be used to transport his catering supplies.

loans.use: to purchase warming dishes for his catering service.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret is 36 years old and married with six children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling bread in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Magret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more breads and cake for sale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her in expanding her business and paying the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and cake to sell

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 43, is a resident of Maligaya Echague. She is married and has nine children. Marivic’s earnings go to meet daily needs, pay her electric bill and for allowances for the children.

For almost the past twenty years Marivic has made furniture. She is able to earn about 2,000 PHP monthly. According to her, her finished products are distributed to other villages where she has agents.

Marivic is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy materials such as wood, varnish and nails. By improving her furniture, she hopes to encourage more customers to buy it.

Marivic hopes that she will be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to buy materials such as  woods, varnish and nails.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past four years Teopista has operated a market where she sells a variety of essential commodities like soap and sugar.

Teopista is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. To help expand her business, she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC. The loan will be used to purchase more of these commodities to sell.

Through the loan Teopista hopes to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. In the future Teopista hopes to expand her business so as to employ more workers.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities like soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, 56, is married, has six children and is from Maligaya Echague. For almost ten years she has owned a small, home-based sari-sari store. Her husband contributes the salary he earns as a carpenter to the household expenses.

Elena is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, oil, biscuits and soft drinks. She wants to use this loan to keep the store well-stocked and to meet customer's demands. This small loan she is requesting will help her improve her income and support her child in college.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as rice, sugar, oil, biscuits and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, neither of whom is yet in school. Godfrey has been a farmer for the past two years.

Godfrey is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. To help expand his farm, he is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC which will be used to purchase passion fruit seeds to cultivate.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Godfrey hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family. In the future, Godfrey hopes to become a big businessman in Kalisizo town.

loans.use: to purchase passion fruit seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 47 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж вместе с детьми находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Гулбахор имеет среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке района. У нее имеется торговая точка, где она продает школьную форму и женские национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности Гулбахор занимается уже два года. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Gulbahor lives in Shahritus region, she is 47 years old and has completed high school. Gulbahor is married and has three children. Her husband and her children are all working away in Russia. She herself is working in retail at the local market. Gulbahor has a market stall where she sells school uniforms and women's national clothes. Gulbahor has been selling clothing for the last two years. She would like to take out this loan to purchase clothes for the upcoming fall and the starting school season.

loans.use: To buy seasonal goods

loans.name: Felma

texts.en:
Felma is from Maligaya Echague. She is 41 years old, married and lives with three family members.

For the past five years Felma has been the owner of a furniture shop. She makes and sells chairs, tables, cabinets, beds and doors made of wood.

Felma has decided to apply for a 8,000 PHP loan to buy wood, varnish and nails for her furniture business. She is aiming to make more in profits so as to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish and nails for her furniture business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, a 58-year-old widow who has worked as a tailor for seven years, enjoys her business. Though a single parent, she has been able to raise her children through the income she generates from her tailoring and snack-vending businesses.

Erlinda plans to have her own tailoring shop someday in order to display all of her sample curtains; currently she brings her samples to the market to encourage sales. She is highly motivated to improve her enterprise in order to increase her income.

Erinda is now requesting a loan of P10,000 to buy garments to make curtains and ingredients to make native cakes. She hopes to make her dreams come true through her hard work and patience in managing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy garments for making curtains and ingredients for making native cakes.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly, a 34-year-old married mother of two children, both of whom are in school, lives in the town of Masaka in the Masaka region of Uganda. For the past four years, Elly has operated a small retail shop that sells items such as sugar and salt.

To help expand her business, Elly has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as sugar and salt for resale in the hope of generating greater profits to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Elly hopes to expand her business further.

Elly is a member of BRAC's small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old and lives in the town of Lukaya in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past four years Agnes has had a small shop where she sells soft drinks, water and other daily use items.

Agnes is a member of BRAC Uganda’s small enterprise program. To help expand her business, she has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC which will be used to purchase more shop inventory for resale.

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Agnes hopes to generate greater profits and so pay school fees for her children. In the future, Agnes hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more shop inventory for resale.

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 15 Group

texts.en:
Siti is 42 years old, has two children and lives in Cilincing. She is one of the group’s entrepreneurs and sells adult’s and children’s clothes on credit.

Since 2006 Siti has sold clothes from her house and around the neighborhood. With earnings from this business she has helped her husband to pay for her children’s school fees.

This is will be Siti’s second loan through VisionFund Indonesia. She is asking for 2,000,000 IDR to buy more clothes to sell. In the future she hopes she can open a kiosk in Pasar Koja and go on a pilgrimage.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 31 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. She also earns income from selling onions. Stella took this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order charcoal to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her in building up her business and paying the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo is 33 years old and single. He has a home-based sari-sari store where he sells different basic groceries. He is a man who works hard to contribute to the household economy and give his family a better lifestyle.

Leonardo is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, sugar and shampoo. Some of this amount will also be used to buy and sell vegetables.

Leonardo hopes he can maintain his clientele and encourage more customers to come to his store. His goal is to increase his profits so as to be able to transform his wooden store into a concrete one.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as soft drinks, biscuits, sugar and shampoo to resell.

loans.name: Suiun's Group

texts.en:
Suiun is the leader of this group. She is 63, married and has raised a son and three daughters, all of whom are employed.

Together with her husband, Suiun breeds cattle and farms. Their monthly profits are about 5,000 KGS which they use to meet their daily needs. These profits also made it possible for Suiun to purchase household appliances to improve their living conditions.

With a loan of 65,000 KGS received from Mol Bulak, she wants to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she plans to start repairing their house.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle.

loans.name: Chiedza Group

texts.en: This is 35 year old Fikelephi from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is married with six children, four of whom are attending school. She also cares for four dependents. Fikelephi runs a transportation business. The business has been in operation for 4 years. She says the main challenges faced are high repair costs due to unavailability of spare tires. Fikelephi has requested a loan of $400 to purchase spare tires and tools. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to send her dependents to school and improve the family's quality of life. In the future Fikelephi plans to have a larger fleet of commuter buses.

loans.use: To purchase tools and spare tires

loans.name: Siyazama Group

texts.en: Orita is 57 years old and lives  in Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. She is single with five children. She also cares for one dependent. Orita runs a retail business selling poultry and clothes. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenges faced are shortage of cash to order stock. Orita has requested a loan of $400 to purchase chickens and clothes from Zambia. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to improve her family’s lifestyle with better food types and more disposable income to purchase assets. In the future Orita plans to own a personal car and a possible venture into the transport industry.

loans.use: To purchase chickens-broilers and layers for sale.

loans.name: Kebon Bawang Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 48 year years old, married and has four children. Since July, 2009 she has sold Pop Ice, a kind of soft drink from a kiosk in front of her house. Pop Ice comes in many flavors such as orange, strawberry, mocha, cappuccino, chocolate and mango.

Ruth is asking for a 1,000,000 IDR loan to add more varieties of Pop Ice flavors to her inventory. In the future she wants to expand her kiosk and add some snacks. She hopes she can continually send her little children to school.

loans.use: to add more varieties of Pop Ice flavors to her inventory.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 55 years old and is a married man with five children. He built a backyard piggery where he raises pigs. He also tills a parcel of land and grows rice and corn crops. Jose works hard to improve his family's living conditions.

Jose plans to use his loan of 12,000 PHP from CEVI to purchase vitamins and both growth and finisher feed for his hogs. He hopes this loan will help his hog-raising business grow.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and both growth and finisher feed for his hogs.

loans.name: Sayniso

texts.ru: Сайнисо проживает в районе Шахритус. Ей 41 год. Она разведена. У нее один ребенок. Сайнисо занимается торговлей на рынке. Она в основном продает детскую и подростковую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для покупки детской одежды.
texts.en: Sayniso lives close to Shahrituz. She is 41 years old, divorced, with one child. She has a stall in the market and sells mainly children and teenage clothing. She has been selling for four years and needs a loan to purchase more children's clothes.

loans.use: to purchase children's clothing.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 26 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are in school. She has a business selling beauty supplies and clothes to her customers in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years. Jane requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profit for her business to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Compained Group

texts.en: This is 43 year old John from Gweru, the capital of Midlands province in Zimbabwe. He is married with four children, two of whom are attending school. He also cares for two dependents. John runs a metal fabrication business and makes door and window frames. The business has been in operation for 21 years. He says the main challenge faced is lack of raw materials. John has requested a loan of $400 to buy a machine sealer. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him to improve business prospects and consequently profit margins. In the future John plans to significantly expand his business.

loans.use: To buy a sealer machine

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 53-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has worked in selling home products since 14 years ago. He is a hardworking man with a good reputation. He has improved his business in a very professional way, depending on his customers' needs and requests.

This is Hassan's second loan cycle with Al Majmoua. Just like with his previous loan, Hassan will invest this requested loan in increasing his capital through buying new merchandise requested by his customers. This will have a good benefit for him.

Hassan had cash flow  problems at the beginning, but now he's more organized and aware of every step he makes, and that's all because he has a loving family he has to take care of.

Hassan hopes to improve his business through expanding his shop and adding new products.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato, with her children. She is a widow. Juliana works hard to support her children.

Juliana has been engaged in farming for more than 35 years. She grows rice and corn crops and sells her harvest to rice traders at her town. Juliana earns about 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month doing this farming.

Juliana has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to acquire the farming equipment that she needs and to have a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Islombek

texts.ru:
Исломбек трудолюбивый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 4 детей.  Его жена домохозяйка и воспитывает своих детей. Исломбек более 18 лет занимается приготовлением блюд и имеет свой собственный кафе. Он приготавливает вкусные еды, и имеет много клиентов. Он старается, обслужит своих клиентов с высококачественными продуктами. Исломбек планирует покупать морозильника для сырья, чтобы продукты не испортились, а также мука и лук для запаса на зиме. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Islombek is a hard-working and coscientious man.  He's married and the loving father of four children.  His wife is a homemaker who is bringing up their children.  Islombek has had his own cafe and been preparing meals for more than eighteen years.  His food is delicious and he has a lot of customers, to whom he strives to deliver a top-quality product.  He's planning to buy a freezer for the cheese so it doesn't go bad, and he'll stock up on flour and onions for winter.  To this end, he's seeking a loan of 3000USD.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wool.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
"Life is like a wheel" is David's favorite quotation. He is 59 years old and happily married. He is blessed with nine children. Four of his children are already married. One child is working abroad, and the rest are in school.

David is a farmer, and his wife is a housekeeper. They both manage their farming business, which involves planting and harvesting corn. Aside from the farming business, David is also engaged in a hog-raising business. David and his wife are trying their best to sustain their family's needs, especially their children's education.

David wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He wants to expand his business to get higher earnings and to continue sending his children to school to finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
At the age of 24, Benjie got married. He is now 32 years old with two children. He is married to a hard-working and loving wife, Analyn. They always seem to look for a better way of life for their family, and that's why they did not stick only in the farming business.

Benjie operates his tricycle for passenger transport, which serves as an extra source of income to him. He has also managed his hog-raising business for five years. His hog-raising business is not stable because of his financial status. Actually, Benjie wants to continue his hog-raising business, because it was temporarily stopped.

Last month, Benjie sold his hogs. He is not able to buy piglets, because his earnings went to the hospitalization of and medicine for their child who is suffering an illness. Thus, Benjie is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise. He looks forward to the success of his business.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo's biggest dream in life is for his son to finish his engineering studies. Eduardo is 50 years old and is married to a loving, patient, and gorgeous woman. They are blessed with six children.

Eduardo is a farmer, and his wife is a housekeeper. Eduardo and his wife manage their corn farming business. Aside from that, Eduardo also manages a hog raising business, while his wife runs a small canteen inside the school in their village. His wife sells snacks like pancakes, juice, and soup.

Eduardo needs additional capital for his eight pigs. He wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs. He knows that this loan will be a big help for him in supplying the feed to his pigs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his pigs.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa is 51 years old and lives with her two sons in a house in Hentii Province in Mongolia. Her oldest son has his own private business, and her other son studies at high school. She has 20 milking cows and sells about 90 liters of milk on a daily basis. Her daily sales income is 50,000 MNT. She already has a constant client base, and she has 10 years of experience. She started selling milk and dairy products in 2000. In the future, she wants to build a cow farm. She is a hard-working and energetic woman who says, "My business is the only source of income, and I want to expand my business." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase milking cows for her cow herd.

loans.use: To purchase milking cows.

loans.name: Amin

texts.en: Amin is 28 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school. She has a business selling tea in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been running this business for two years. Amin requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her in building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment for selling tea

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Elmer is married to a young and beautiful lady named Misael. Their one child attends elementary school. Elmer is a farmer, and his wife is a former Overseas Filipino Worker.

Aside from planting and harvesting corn, Elmer has a hog raising business. He started this business while his wife was abroad. His wife came back to the Philippines and decided not to go back abroad, and she helps Elmer in managing their business.

Elmer wanted to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy feed for the maintenance of his twelve pigs. He always hopes to succeed in his business and to grow as an entrepreneur and borrower.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his twelve pigs.

loans.name: Mariama B.

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Mariama. She is married to a petty trader, and she has two children, ages 19 and 22 years. She has three additional dependents living with her, because she takes care of them while they attend school in the city. In 2001, Mariama established her gara clothing (locally dyed clothing) business. She began her business, because she wanted to be self-employed in order to have a dependable means of earning income and to help her husband provide livelihood for their children. She made good profits for the upkeep of her family, and that is why she loves this type of business.

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 540,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Mariama requires a loan in order to buy one bale of brilliant materials to produce different types of gara cloth, including clothing, bedding, and curtains. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 280,000 SLL.

In the future, Mariama plans to open a big shop and to sponsor her children as they go through their education smoothly. Rises in transportation costs and inflation are her major business challenges. Competition is high, but she offers the best and latest fashion, giving her an edge over her competitors. She supplies customers in Freetown and Makeni Town, offering the latest patterns and designs to fit her customers' needs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy one bale of brilliant materials to produce different types of gara cloth.

loans.name: Gles

texts.en:
Gles is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. He is a farmer, while his wife is a housekeeper. His wife also has a sari-sari store (general store) business in which she sells breads, spices, sugar, vinegar, and cooking oil. His wife's income from the business went to the daily consumption of the family.

Gles plants and harvests corn and vegetables. Gles also runs a hog-fattening business to earn additional income. He wants to expand the business and earn a higher income to use for the improvement of their house. Gles wishes to borrow 15,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Soriano

texts.en:
At age 45, Soriano has four school-age children, and his oldest child is already beginning a college-level education. Soriano is a farmer, and his wife is a housekeeper. He works hard and strives just to feed his family and to provide a good quality of life.

Soriano has operated his hog raising business for almost five years, but it is not steady because of a lack of financial resources. For this reason, Soriano is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise. He wants his hog raising business to be a stable business aside from farming and to be able to fulfill his responsibility to his family.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise.

loans.name: Jiydakan's Group

texts.en:
Jiydakan is the treasurer of this group. She is 57 and is unfortunately a widow. She has three sons, the first son lives separately, the second son is in Russia and the third son works as a taxi driver ‒ he lives together with his mom. Jiydakan works as a nurse.  She is also engaged in cattle breeding. Her sister suggested to her to start this business to make additional money to meet the family's needs. Jiydakan applied for this loan because she needs the funds to purchase cattle. In the future, she wants to see all her sons get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mahmarajab

texts.ru: Махмарачаб проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Махмарачаб имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии работает уже год. Кроме того он уже два года как занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян лука, минеральных удобрений и топлива.
texts.en: Mahmarajab lives near Shahrituz. He is 24 years, old, married with two children. His wife works at the local farm. He has a college degree in education and has been a teacher for one year. For two years, he has been mainly growing vegetables for sale. He is asking for a loan to purchase onion seed, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.use: to purchase onion seed, fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She has owned a mobile phones shop since 18 years ago, when her phone shop was the first in her region. She's a smart and talented woman with good customer service. Rima is a hardworking woman and seeks perfection in her business.  She works hard to please her customers.

Rima is starting a new business. She is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua-Kiva partner  in order to buy an Espresso machine, tables, chairs, an orange and carrot juicer, and hookas, in order to open a small cafe that will be very good business for Ramadan evenings and will generate good income in the future.  

Rima helps her husband a lot in everything, especially in their income and expenses. Rima hopes to take another courageous step forward to expand her business more and more in the future, and to improve her family's social and financial situation.

loans.use: To start a new cafe business

loans.name: Guiller

texts.en: Guiller is an industrious person.He has been a farmer in the Philippines for 18 years. He is 33 years old,  married to a simple housewife, and is blessed with three children. He is requesting a loan amount of P25,000  to buy insecticides and fertilizers for his farm.He manages it carefully because this is the main source of income for his family. He usually earns P50,000 during the seasons of April and October.He saves some of the income for security purposes in emergencies when he gets weak and to be able to give his children a higher level of education.

loans.use: buy insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Joferson

texts.en:
Joferson is 35 years of age.  He is married and is  blessed with two children. He has been managing his rice field for almost ten years and usually earns about P35,000 per harvest during the seasons of April and October.  He sets aside some of his income for their daily use and for the education of his two children. He has been working hard to earn a higher income for the next crop. 

Joferson is asking a loan amount P25,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farm. He  needs to improve his rice field by providing all the inputs needed to be able to make it productive and profitable. He hopes that he can sustain the financial needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for his farm

loans.name: Asusa

texts.en: Asusa is 22 years old and married with five children. Four of the children are in school. She has a business selling bread and cake in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years. Asusa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more breads to sell

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru:
Умедджон добрый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Когда ему было 17 лет он начал выращивать сельскохозяйственных культур, и набрал достаточно богатый опыт. Сегодняшний день выращивает пшеницу, хлопок, арбуз, дыня, лук и рис. Ему помогает жена для переработки земли и посева семена. У него хорошие поливные земли. Он имеет постоянные клиенты, которые оптом покупает. Умедджон запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки семена риса и минеральных удобрений. Он заранее благодарит всех вас за вашу помощь и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Umedjon is a good and honest man.  He is married and the devoted father of three children.  When he was seventeen, he started raising crops and got quite of bit of experience.  Nowadays he grows wheat, cotton, watermelons, melons, onions, and rice.  His wife helps him work the land and plant seeds.  He has good, irrigated fields and steady customers that buy wholesale.  Unedjon is seeking a loan of 3000USD to buy rice seed and fertilizer.  He thanks everyone in advance for your help and encouragement.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 25 years old and married with three children. Two of her children are in school. She has a business selling tea. She has been running this business for two years.

Susan requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for selling tea.

loans.name: Bulak Indah Group

texts.en: Eni lives in Cilincing. She is already married and has 3 children. In 2005, she started selling Ketoprak, a type of food that contains vegetables. Doing this business, she can help her husband to increase the family income. She has requested 2,000,000 Indonesian rupiah to pay for more ingredients for Ketoprak. She plans for business expansion and in the future she wants to repair her house and give her children a better education than she had.

loans.use: to pay for Ketoprak ingredients

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 48-year-old married woma and mother of 3 children.  She started working as a tailor 18 years ago to provide her family with good and healthy living.  Mariam is a hardworking woman, she started her business from home because of the lack of money she was facing, and because she thought it's the best place to be next to her beloved family members to take good care of them and finish the requested work at the same time.  She is a talented woman with very good experience and her business has improved a lot through the increase in the number of customers she has gained over time.  

Mariam is a woman with a good reputation.  She does her best to improve her business and wants to update her machines.  She has requested a loan  from A. Majmoua  to buy two professionA. tailoring machines.  These will help her finish the requested work in a short period of time with the best quality.

Mariam hopes to open a tailoring shop in the future. She believes that when her business grows more, she has to expand to a bigger place to gain more customers.

loans.use: buy two sewing machines

loans.name: Mahule Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHULE est composé de trois personnes qui sont toutes de la même famille. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Séverine est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Séverine est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Séverine est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Honoré. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. Séverine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants. Séverine a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,  Séverine mène comme activité la vente des condiments de sauce. Séverine s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de leur clientèle, Séverine et les autres membres du groupe MAHULE sollicitent un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group MAHULE is composed of three persons who all from the same family. The group’s representative, by the name of Séverine, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. With the goal of boosting their business in order to cope better with customer demand, the group members are requesting for the third time financial support from ALIDé. 

Séverine is 32 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a welder by the name of Honoré, and they have four children who are all in school. Three of the children are their own.
