Séverine and her husband live together with their children. She has had very little schooling. To support herself and her children, she runs a business selling condiments for making sauces. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and further satisfying customer demand, Séverine and the other members of the group MAHULE are requesting a third loan from ALIDé. The loans previously received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments for making sauces

loans.name: Minsomahu Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MINSOMAHU est composé de sept personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Chantal est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Chantal est âgé de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Chantal  est marié à un mécanicien du nom de Kenedy. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Chantal  a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Chantal  mène comme activité la vente des vivres. A côté de cette activité Chantal  vend de la friperie. Chantal  mène cette activité depuis vingt ans  environs. Chantal s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu Chantal  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MINSOMAHU, un troisième crédit. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group MINSOMAHU is composed of seven persons who lives in the same district. This is the third time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for boosting their businesses. The group’s representative, by the name of Chantal, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 40 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a mechanic by the name of Kenedy, and they have five children who are all in school. Three of the children are their own. The children live together with their parents. Chantal has attended middle school. 

To support herself and her family, Chantal runs a business selling staple foods. Aside from this, she sells second-hand clothing. She has been in this business for about 20 years. She gets her supplies from the markets of Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and her revenues, she and the other members of the group MINSOMAHU are requesting a third loan. The loans previously received have indeed been repaid.

loans.use: to buy bales of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Tillo

texts.ru: Тилло жительница района Шахритус. Ей 49 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее старший сын и муж уехали на заработки в Москву. Сама Тилло занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает фрукты и овощи. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки клубники, яблок, груши, помидоров и винограда.
texts.en: Tillo lives in the Shahrituz region. She's forty-nine years old, married and has four children. Her husband and oldest son work in Moscow. Tillo rents a stall on the market, selling fruits and vegetables. Her business has been active for the past twenty years. She's asking for a loan to buy strawberries, apples, pears, tomatoes and grapes.

loans.use: to purchase strawberries, apples, pears, tomatoes and grapes

loans.name: Book Juboo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "BOOK JUBOO" se compose de cinq femmes qui habitent la même rue.Chaque femme gère sa propre activité qui lui permet de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer la nourriture des enfants.Le chef du groupe a six enfants dont deux seulement vont à l'école.Elle transforme les graines d'arachide en patte qu'elle revend aux familles environnantes.Elle vend aussi du mil. Son activité lui rapporte des revenus modestes qui lui sont toutefois très utiles pour satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de ses enfants.Afin d'augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, le groupe sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de  250 000f pour l'achat de 5 sacs d'arachide, 5 sacs de mil et des produits divers.Son ambition est d'acheter une cantine au marché central pour élargir sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The "BOOK JUBOO" group is made up of five women who live in the same street. Each woman manages her own business which allows her to support  herself and improve her children's food. The leader of the group has six children, of whom only two attend school. She sells ice, especially during periods of very hot weather. She also processes peanuts into peanut butter which she sells to surrounding families. These activities bring her a modest income which is very useful in satisfying some of her needs and as well as those of her children. Her ambition is to buy a little shop at the central market so she can expand her clientele. 

The members of the group, looking to grow their working capital, are asking UIMCEC for a loan of 250,000 francs to buy five sacks of peanuts, five sacks of millet, cloth and various other products.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of millet and other food products

loans.name: Mahoussi Senade Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUSSI SENADE est composé de deux personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la deuxième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Houénafa Audrey est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Houénafa Audrey est âgée de 36 ans et vit au Bénin. Houénafa Audrey est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Fabrice. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Houénafa Audrey mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente des produits divers. Houénafa Audrey s'approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Houénafa Audrey sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUSSI SENADE, un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
The group MAHOUSSI SENADE is comprised of two persons who are friends. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Houénafa Audrey, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 36 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher by the name of Fabrice, and they have three children, who are both in school and in their care.

To support herself and her children, Houénafa Audrey has been running a business for five years selling a variety of goods. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, her group MAHOUSSI SENADE is requesting a second loan.

loans.use: to buy various goods

loans.name: Abed Al Jalil

texts.en:
Abed A. Jalil is a 52-year-old married man. He is the father of four children, who represent his whole life as he describes them.

Abed A. Jalil opened his shop two years ago. He sells chicken and frozen meat. He loves his business a lot, and he works on improving it.

He's not a butcher, and he has no idea how to be. That's why he turned to selling frozen meat and not fresh. His business is welcoming in the area, and you can always find his shop clean, which is the main thing his customers seek.

Abed A. Jalil is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua, in order to buy the necessary merchandise to improve his business for the holy month of Ramadan. This is his second time as a borrower from A. Majmoua. His previous loan was very impressive, and at the same time, he was a borrower in good standing.

He is planning to expand his business more by opening a grocery store in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary merchandise to improve his business for the holy month of Ramadan.

loans.name: Chumagul

texts.ru:
Чумагуль  умная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 3 детей. Её муж является бизнесменом.  Она занимается купля продажей женской одежды и обуви. Она торгует на центре рынка города, где там много народов. У неё много постоянных клиентов и она с радостью их обслуживает. Чумагуль старается, расширить свой бизнес и получить максимальный прибыл. Он хочет, обучит своих детей в хороших школах и университетах. Чумагуль хотела бы получить займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента одежды и обуви с целью расширения бизнеса. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Chumagul is a smart and trustworthy woman. She is married and the loving mother of three. Her husband is a businessman. She resells women’s clothing and shoes. She works as a vendor at the central market of her town, where there are always many people. She has many loyal customers and enjoys helping them. Chumagul does her best to expand her business and maximize her profits. She would like to send her children to good schools and universities. Chumagul would like to receive a loan of 2,000 USD in order to buy a new assortment of clothing and shoes, with the goal of expanding her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Mt Rungwe Group

texts.en:
Habibu, who is in his mid-40s is married with four children; three of them go to school.  He has been selling fruits and vegetables for six years now.  He works from 6 a.m to 7:30 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he wants to use for buying more fruits and vegetable to sell.  His dream is to one day be able to finish his house which he has started building.

He will share this loan with his loan group "MT Rungwe" which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Enagnon (Sata) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ENAGNON (SATA) est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Zéliatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Zéliatou est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Zéliatou est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Ibrahim. Le couple a un enfant scolarisé et à leur charge. Zéliatou a très peu  fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de son enfant, Zéliatou mène comme activité depuis cinq ans la vente de tissus, de chaussures et des foulards. Zéliatou s’approvisionne  au Togo, État voisin du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Zéliatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON (SATA), un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group ENAGNON (SATA) is comprised of three persons who live in the same house. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating their level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Zéliatou, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a retailer by the name of Ibrahim, and they have one  child, who is in school and in their care. 

To support herself and her children, Zéliatou has been running a business for five years selling cloth, shoes, and scarves. She gets her supplies from Togo, a country neighboring Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, Zéliatou and the other members of the group ENAGNON (SATA) are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cloth, and scarves

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
S. is in his early 30s and is married with three children; two of them go to school.  He has had a butcher business since 2003. He works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be his 2nd "Motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania  given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their  loans  smoothly. They receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. He used the previous loan to buy more meat, fresh fish, chicken, household expenses and has paid back his loan successfully. He wants a loan to increase stock of meat in his the butcher shop.  His dream is to one day open another butchery in a different area.
 
He will share this loan with his loan group "Muungano" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock of meat in his  butcher shop..

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a married man with three children, aged 10 yrs, 6 yrs and a year old. Two of his children attend school while one is still too young for school. He lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a fuel (diesel and petrol) selling business, selling retail to car operators and motorcycle operators. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting fuel to his place of operation. He dreams of expanding his business to sell wholesale in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 he wants to purchase fuel for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase fuel for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a shaving machine and a mirror.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi is a married woman with three children; one attends school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a carpentry business, selling to her neighbours. She also does farming, her other source of income. Her major challenge is seasonality in the business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to expand her business to sell wholesale and purchase lumber. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business to sell wholesale and purchase lumber.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.fr:
Mohamed est  un homme âgé de 39ans. Il est célibataire.
Mohamed travaille comme revendeur de tissus depuis 2005. Il vend à ses clients  au marché d’Adawlato. Il achète les produits au même lieu. 
Mohamed a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus.
texts.en:
Mohamed is a man of 39 and single. He has been working selling clothes since 2005. He sells to his customers at the market of Adawlato. He buys his goods in the same place. 
 
Mohamed has requested his first loan with WAGES to buy more clothing.

loans.use: to buy jeans for resale.

loans.name: Kaja Group

texts.en:
Mbonea, who is in his late 30s, is married with four children who go to school. He has been selling fresh fish from door to door for three years now. He works from 11a.m to 3 p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. He wants to use the funds to buy more fish and to pay school fees as well. His dream is to one day be able to rent a shop where he can sell his fish in one place.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Kaja", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and to pay school fees as well.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, fresh milk and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, fresh milk and rice.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with six children: four attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two months, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children: two attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to her neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the month of April and May the availability of coconuts is lower in supply compared to demand. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a single man with one school-going child. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four months, he has operated a grocery selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the dry, hot season the availability of green vegetables is low in supply compared to demand. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 10,000 loan, he wants to purchase a crate of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and green vegetables. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase a crate of potatoes, onions, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Galilaya Group

texts.en:
Agness, who is in her late 30s, is married and has four children. Three of her children go to school. She has had a food selling business for two years now. She works from 5:00 AM to 4:00 PM daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stock, and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her food stock and to buy one sack of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to buy big quantities of food and to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Galilaya," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase her food stock and to buy one sack of charcoal.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a 34 year old married man, father of one child. Moustafa has been a school bus driver since 4 years ago. He has also been a mechanic for 12 years.

Moustafa started working double businesses because he planned to provide his family with a better brighter future. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua because he wants to exchange his bus with a modern new one. A new bus will iensure his students' comfort and increase the number of students he can serve.

This is Moustafa's third cycle with Al Majmoua. All of his previous loans helped in improving his business and reflected positively on his social and financial situation. He is a borrower in good standing. His good reputation helps a lot in encouraging a lot of families to assign him to transport their children to and from school. He hopes to increase the number of buses he owns to expand his working area.

loans.use: to buy a new bus to replace the one he has.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, Salome has operated a retail shop business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 60,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, nails, and gutters and to pay labour costs.

loans.name: Esnass

texts.en:
Enass is the business of selling water tanks. By facilitating a means for people to store clean water, Enass is helping Kenyans improve their standard of life. He has been diligently running this business for the past 2 years. Enass intends to use his loan to buy more water tanks he plans to resell. 

This is Enass’s 2nd loan with SMEP. He is a client that pays back his loan on time. Enass describes himself as talented, diversified, and open minded. He intends to use the profits from his business to start a branded bottle water company that distills safe drinking water. He hopes to expand his business to international levels.

loans.use: to buy more water tanks.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.en:
Sophia is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a mahamri (dumplings) selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and charcoal.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is a married woman with six children; three attend school, while three have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Damaris has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business – selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she makes natural fruit juice for sale which contributes another source of income. She faces the major challenges of high transportation costs and also seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With this 80,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Nefisa

texts.en:
Nefisa is 40 years old. She has three children. One of her children is in school. She is a widow. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator branch. She has been running this business for five years.

Nefisa requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says the profit will help her build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with one child.  They live in their own house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has been operating a kindergarten school, teaching children from the neighboring community. She faces a major challenge in delayed payments by parents with children attending the school. She dreams of establishing her school to incorporate other classes in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 20,000, Saumu wants to purchase stationery books for the school. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy stationery books for her school

loans.name: Tujimbere Group

texts.fr:
Claudine est une commerçante  âgée de 29 ans . Elle habite au centre-ville  de Gitega au centre du Burundi.  Elle fait marcher un restaurant  depuis 10 ans,un commerce qu’elle commence alors qu’elle vendait les bananes  à côte du métier de cultivateur. 

Elle a fait les études jusqu’au niveau du primaire. Elle est mariée  à Leonidas,un fonctionnaire et  ont ensemble 3 enfants dont 2 étudient a l’ecole primaire .
 
Le crédit de Kiva de 300,000 Fbu va lui permettre  d’augmenter  le capital  afin d’acheter  une plus grande quantite de produits alimentaires consommés dans le restaurant pour réaliser  de grands bénefices. 
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire  “TUJIMBERE”
texts.en:
Claudine, 29 and a small-scale merchant, lives in the center of the town of Gitega in the middle of Burundi.  She has been running a restaurant for 10 years, a business she began when she was still selling bananas and working as a farmer. 

She attended school up to the primary level. She is married to Leonidas, a civil servant with whom she has three children. Two of them are in primary school. 
 
The Kiva loan of 300,000 Fbu will permit her to increase her working capital in order to buy a bigger quantity of the foodstuffs consumed in her restaurant, so that she can make more profit. 

She is a member of the community group “TUJIMBERE”.

loans.use: to grow her working capital and buy a bigger quantity of the foodstuffs consumed in her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Mwanza

texts.en:
Mwanza is a married man with thirteen children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the loan for Kshs 40,000, Mwanza wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: buy flour, maize flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy beans and maize

loans.name: Dehiya

texts.en:
Dehiya is 40 years old with seven children. Four of her children are in school. She is married. She has a business selling charcoal in Kator branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Dehiya requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profit to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with one child who is too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills.

Mary has operated a clothes selling business for over ten years.  She sells in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Mnyazi has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 65,000, Mnyazi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour and sugar to resell

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 44 years old, married and has two children in school. He has been doing welding for two years to earn a living. He makes and sells door and window frames. In addition, he does dairy farming for extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business, hence improving his family’s standard of living.

Geoffrey hopes to become a successful businessman in the future. He has requested for 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine.

loans.use: to buy  a welding machine.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 41 years old, married and has three children in school.  He does farming to earn a living. He also owns a motorbike, which he uses for a transport business. With the two businesses, he is able to provide for his family. He has been able to retain his businesses with the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Stephen hopes that one day; he will become a successful businessman. He has requested for 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Kadongo

texts.en:
Kadongo is a married man with three school-going children. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over twenty years, he has operated a poultry selling business. His potential customers are neighbours and town dwellers. In addition, he also operates a goatmeat business, which contributes as his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. His major dream is to expand his business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Chirima

texts.en:
Chirima is a married man with one child who doesn’t attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

Chirima has been operated a goatmeat selling business for the past twenty years, selling as wholesale to his neighbors and butcher operators. He faces a major challenge of theft in his business. He dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 62 years old, widowed and has three children. She owns a boutique shop in Kitengela, Nairobi where she sells clothes. She has been doing this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 4,000 per month.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff, and she has got a good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy more clothes. She will use the extra profit to boost her boutique business.

Joyce hopes to grow her business and to become a wholesaler in the near future. She is very hardworking and a focused lady.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Emily Owuor

texts.en:
Emily is 47 years old, married and has five children. Emily owns a second hand business (mutumba) in Githurai-Kahawa Barracks where she sells bedding and furnishings. She has been in this business for the past three years and earns an income of KES 22,700 per month.

Emily was introduced to KADET by a friend. She is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD and plans to use the loan to purchase more bedding and curtains for sale. Emily will use the extra profit to expand the business and to educate her children.

Emily hopes to grow the business and to open her own premises. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy stock for sale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 40 years old, married and has three children. He has been operating a motorbike transport business for over ten years. He was able to start the business with the financial support from Faulu Kenya. He also owns a retail shop which generates extra income for his family. He managed to stop being an employee and to go into business full-time.  
Peter hopes to improve his business and to start a taxi business in the future. He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a motorbike and to add stock to his retail shop.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and to stock his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a married woman with two children: one attends school while the other is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

Peris has operated a tailoring business for the past 10 years; her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her big dream is to establish a dressmaking school in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to purchase material and an overlocker. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase material and an overlocking machine.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar and wheat flour.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 29 years old, married and has three children.  To earn a living, he sells vehicle spare parts.  He has been in the business for over eight years and has employed two people.  Previously, he was involved in a van transport business.  Through his hard work, he has grown his business.  He has also benefited from the financial training conducted by Faulu Kenya.

John hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy spare parts.

loans.use: buy spare parts to sell

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with six children, four attend school while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past four years, Salima has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop and establishing a clothes selling business. 

With the Kshs 40,000, Salima wants to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a married woman with three children -- two attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity and school fees.

For the past three years, Evaline has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in competition from other clothes sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Evaline wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Frankline

texts.en:
Frankline is a widower with two boys who are attending school. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees and clothing.

For the past ten years, Frankline has operated a carpentry business, selling in a shop to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge in competition from other carpentry operators in the area. He dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Frankline wants to expand his workshop and purchase more timber. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: expand his workshop and purchase more timber

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 34 years old, married and has two children in school. He is a plumber by profession. Thomas earns additional income from his retail shop, which he has been operating for eleven years. He employs two people to assist him as he provides plumbing services.

Thomas has benefited from Faulu Kenya because he has learned how to save his money and to manage his business. He has requested for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to add stock of soda and eggs to his shop.

loans.use: To add stock of soda and eggs.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 38 years old, married and has three children in school. He runs a transport business to earn a living for his family. He has been in the business for three years and has employed two people to assist him. Besides, he is employed. He has retained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.

Augustine hopes to own more Lorries for his transport business in the future. He has requested for 50,000 Kenyan shillings to repair his lorry.

loans.use: to repair his lorry.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has one child who is still too young for school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are her rent bills and food for the family.

For the past three years, Caroline has operated a cereal selling business, selling in a shop to her local residents. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and the fluctuation of product pricing. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase sacks of soya beans, maize and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of soya beans, maize and rice.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 64 years old, married and has two sons. He has been running a small retail shop called the “Baraka Shop” for the last two years. He sells sugar, rice, unga (flour), and other goods. Godfrey employs 1 person to help him run his business. He intends to use this loan to add more goods to his shop. 

This is Godfrey’s second loan with SMEP. He is a good client who pays back his loan on time. Godfrey hopes to keep expanding his business and own a wholesale shop one day. He describes himself as faithful.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, and unga (flour).

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en: Antonio is 42 years old, married, and has 6 children. He has no other dependents. He owns a semi-permanent house where he lives with 8 people in Hioma, Uganda. His family goal is to make sure his children attain a good education. For 10 years he has been running a bar, amidst the challenge of high costs of operation. His dream is to have a wholesale shop. Antonio intends to use the loan facility to renovate his bar.

loans.use: to renovate his bar.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with four children aged between twenty-three years old and four years old. He operates a small food cafe where he sells chips, coffee, tea, doughnuts and other snacks to the local people in Mombasa. He has been running this business for three years now. He says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge he has is financial constraint.  

Daniel is using his loan of KES 20,000 to add stocks of potatoes for making chips. He hopes to grow his business and in the future expand to a big restaurant. He also wishes to give a good education to his children. He describes himself as a go-getter.

loans.use: buy potatoes to make chips for sale

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 29 years old.  He is married and has 3 children aged between 9 and 2 years old. His wife is a market vendor and they live in their own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. 

Lawrence has been operating a produce business for the last 2 years, selling especially maize and beans. From this business, he has been able to buy land although he faces a challenge in the high inflation rates in the country.  His dream is to buy his own truck to transport his goods. Lawrence needs a loan to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: buy maize and beans

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 32 years old and is a father of 5 children aged 12 to 4 years.  He lives in his own house in Kibaale, Uganda. His spouse is a housewife,  therefore he is the sole bread winner for his family of 7 people. 

Micheal has a shop selling bicycle spare parts and has been operating it for 3 years. He faces a challenge in inflation and defaulters.  His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Micheal needs a loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: buy bicycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 26 years old.  He is married and lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda.  He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after his family and his dream is to set up a sustainable income generating activity.  He has a produce business and has been doing it for 3 years. He faces a challenge of inadequate capital and hopes that in the future his business will grow bigger into a food store. 

John intends to use this loan to buy groundnuts, maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: buy groundnuts, maize and beans to resell

loans.name: Francisco Gerardo

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es casado, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, su esposa es comerciante, se dedica a hacer trabajos de crochet, artesanía en encaje yu.
Tiene casa propia, con las comodidades mínimas dentro del bienestar familiar. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos electrónicos. Realiza sus ventas por toda la ciudad, recorriendo todos los barrios. Comenta que su trabajo es muy duro, ya que todos los días debe salir a tempranas horas para empezar a vender sus mercaderías. Dice que todo lo que realiza es por el bienestar de su familia, ya que desea darles un mejor estilo de vida.
El Solicita el crédito para la compra de aparatos electrónicos como ser mixteras, cafeteras y demás para la posterior venta. Está muy agradecido a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is married and lives in the city of Pilar. His wife is a merchant who makes crocheted items and lace crafts. He has his own home with basic amenities to ensure his family’s welfare. Francisco buys and sells electrical goods. He conducts his sales throughout the city by visiting all neighborhoods. Francisco says that his job is very hard because he works every day and has to leave in the early hours of the morning to start selling his merchandise. He says all of his efforts are geared toward providing for his family's well-being, since he wants to give them a better lifestyle.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy electrical appliances such as mixers, coffee makers, and other items for eventual resale. Francisco is very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances such as mixers, coffee makers, and other items.

loans.name: Ginazio

texts.en: Ginazio is a 38-year-old father of 7 children.  His wife is a tailor.  They live in their own house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For 4 years, Ginazio has been running a business selling local gin.  With the income generated he has been able to build a house and pay school fees for his children. He faces a challenge in the high rate of inflation.  He hopes to diversify his business in future by trading in beers and sodas. Ginazio needs a loan to buy local gin to sell.

loans.use: buy local gin to sell

loans.name: Mwende

texts.en:
Mwende is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past three years, Mwende has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing another bigger business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000, Mwende wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with two children.  He owns a semi-permanent house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family is vested in him and his desire is to educate his children up to university. 

Milton has been selling shoes and clothes for fifteen years.  He got his initial capital from selling coffee. His hardship is high commodity prices that lead to low demand and his vision is having a boutique and building a permanent house for residence.  Milton needs this loan to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 145 Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO 145 est un groupe constitué de deux personnes et dont la représentante(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Zénabou. Les membres du groupe résident dans la même maison. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Zénabou est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à Fernand un gendarme. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur  charge.  Zénabou a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Zénabou vend des sacs de maïs à son domicile et aussi par le système de distribution. Zénabou exerce ce métier depuis près de sept ans ; ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Zénabou s’approvisionne dans une ville du Nord du Bénin. Ce deuxième prêt permettra certainement à  Zénabou et à l'ensemble du groupe GBENONKPO 145, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
GBENONKPO 145 is a group composed of two people. Zénabou (the woman in the photograph who is waving) is the group's spokeswoman. Both members of the group live in the same house. In order to increase their working capital, the group is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. 

Zénabou is 31 and is married to Fernand, a policeman. The couple are raising 3 children who are all in school. Zénabou did not get much schooling. To support herself and her family, she sells bags of corn from her home and through a distribution network. Zénabou has been selling corn for nearly 7 years; this has allowed her, together with her husband, to keep up with the household expenses. Zénabou gets her supplies from a town in Northern Benin. This second loan will certainly allow Zénabou and the whole GBENONKPO 145 group to increase their sales activity levels, their customer base and their revenue.

loans.use: to buy sacs of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy seeds and pay for farm labour

loans.name: Ste Trinite Group

texts.fr: Le groupe STE TRINITE est composé de trois  personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. C'est la deuxième fois  que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Noélie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Noélie est âgée de 30 ans et vit au Bénin. Noélie  est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Noélie a très peu  fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Noélie prépare de la nourriture (riz accampagné de sauce) qu'elle vend à son domicile. Noélie mène cette activité depuis six ans environs. Noélie s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du  Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Noélie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe STE TRINITE, un deuxième crédit. le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group STE TRINITE is comprised of three persons who live in the same house. This is the second time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating its level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Noélie, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 30 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a teacher by the name of Marcellin, and they have three children, who are all in school and in their care. 

Noélie did not have much schooling. To support herself and her children, she makes meals (rice served with sauce) that she sells out of her home. She has been in this business for about six years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the other members of the group STE TRINITE are requesting a second loan. The first one was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy sauce condiments and some rice

loans.name: Grace Divine (Irede) Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GRACE DIVINE (IREDE) est composé de trois personnes qui fréquentent la même église au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ayabavi glady est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Ayabavi glady est âgée de 23 ans et vit au Bénin. Ayabavi glady est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Jean. Le couple n'a pas d'enfant. Ayabavi glady a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Ayabavi glady a appris le métier de coiffure. Ayabavi glady exerce cette activité passionnément depuis cinq ans. A côté de cette activité, Ayabavi glady vend des produits défrisants et des mêches. Ayabavi glady s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Ayabavi glady sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GRACE DIVINE (IREDE), un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The group GRACE DIVINE (IREDE) is comprised of three persons who attend the same church in Benin. This is the first time that this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé for elevating its level of business. The group’s representative, by the name of Ayabavi Glady, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 23 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a retailer by the name of Jean, and they have no children. 

Ayabavi Glady did not have much schooling. To support herself [...], she learned the trade of hairdressing. She has been working with passion in this business for five years. Aside from this work, she sells hair straightening products and hair extensions. She gets her supplies in Benin. 

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the other members of the group GRACE DIVINE (IREDE) are requesting an initial loan.

loans.use: to buy hair straightener products and hair extensions

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a una D. las miembros. Ella se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dando la una visión D. que a través del comité estarían alcanzando un  nuevo progreso a cada una. Encantadas aceptaron formar el comité al que denominaron Kuña Rory. Actualmente el grupo cuenta con doce integrantes. Todas tienen la esperanza D. seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso D. cada una D. ellas y la D. su comunidad.
La señora Juliana es vendedora D. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser frazadas, sabanas, ropas y demás. Por medio D. este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y generar un poco más D. ingresos, con lo cual pueD. ayudar con los gastos D. la casa. Uno D. sus Sueños es poder tener una tienda donD. pueda estar ofreciendo constantemente sus mercaderías.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. sabanas, edredones, ropas y demás para la posterior venta. Por medio D. esto ella podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee formed thanks to one of its members. She was motivated by the idea of creating something good for her team members, giving her a vision that through this committee each of them might achieve a new step forward. Delighted, they agreed to form the committee with the name Kuna Rory. Currently the group has 12 members. All have the hope of continuing the fight to get ahead, looking for progress for each one of them and for the community. 

Juliana is a saleswoman for all sorts of items, like blankets, sheets, clothes and more. Through this work she has been able to come out ahead and to generate a little more income, which helps with the household expenses. One of her dreams is to be able to have a store where she can sell her merchandise all the time. She is requesting a loan to buy sheets, quilts, clothes and the like for resale. With this she can stock up and fill her customers orders.

loans.use: to buy blankets, sheets, quilts and other items for resale.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a thirty-four-year old single mother of three children.  She rents a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been tailoring and selling clothes for six years.  

Hawa started with 500,000 shillings and now has 10,000,000 shillings as her working capital. Her hardships are high prices for goods and bad debtors.  Her dream is having another shop and building a house.  Hawa needs this loan to buy clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.use: buy clothes and shoes to resell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past three years, Jane has operated a tailoring business, making school uniforms for sale. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transporting materials from the market to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan for Kshs 20,000, Jane wants to purchase embroidery materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Jesudegbe Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUDEGBE est composé de quatre personnes qui sont toutes dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Juliette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Juliette est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Abel. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous à leur charge. Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Juliette n’a jamais été à l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Juliette vend du pain sucré depuis six ans environs.  Juliette s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Juliette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUDEGBE, un troisième crédit. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group JESUDEGBE is comprised of four persons who are all in the same district. The group’s representative, by the name of Juliette, is the person with her hand raised in the photo. She is 31 years old and is married to a merchant by the name of Abel, and they have four children, who are all in their care. Some of the children are attending school. The children live together with their parents.

Juliette never attended school. To support herself and her children, she has been selling sugared breads for about six years. She gets her supplies from a city in Benin. Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and her revenues, she and the others in her group JESUDEGBE are requesting a third loan. The two previous loans have both been repaid.

loans.use: to buy baskets of bread

loans.name: Biishe

texts.en:
Biishe is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transporting materials to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business to a dressmaking school in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 loan she wants to purchase cloth materials, embroidery and lace. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, embroidery and lace.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a married woman who lives at her own house; it has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past year, she has operated a beauty salon business. Her potential customers are the neighboring community members and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the price of commodities in the market. She dreams of expanding her beauty salon business in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase shampoo, relaxers, conditioners, weaves and braids. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, relaxers, conditioners, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Lino

texts.es: Lino tiene 47 años, su actividad es la compra y venta de ganado y cerdo. hace mas de 14 años que tiene este negocio, Lino tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. el financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de vacas, toros y chivos. esta no es la primera experiencia que ha obtenido con financiamientos pues ha sido muy elemental para que su negocio siga adelante. el sueño de Lino es de darles a sus hijos una mejor edudacion.
texts.en:
Lino is 47 years old and engages in buying and selling cattle and pigs. He has been in this business for more than 14 years. Lino has two dependent children who are under his responsibility.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cows, bulls, and goats. This is not the first time he has obtained financing, since it has been essential in keeping his business in operation. Lino dreams of providing his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy cows, bulls, and goats.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: El señor Ivan es productor lechero y también cría ganado vacuno; la leche que produce la vende directamente a la empresa PIL ANDINA que es una fábrica industrializadora de productos lácteos. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de un par de vacas lecheras de raza mejorada para mejorar sus ingresos por venta de leche. Ivan y su familia viven en casa de sus padres  ubicada en la localidad de Laja del  departamento de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Ivan is a milk producer and also raises cattle. The milk he produces is sold directly to the PIL Andina Company, which has an industrial factory that processes dairy products. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a pair of dairy cows of improved breed so that he can increase his revenues from selling milk. Ivan and his parents live in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. He is single and has no children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Nolmy Araceli

texts.es: Nolmy Aracely tiene 35 años de edad, y su familia esta integrada por su esposo que se dedica a las actividades de agricultura y por su hija mujer y su hijo varon, ambos estan estudiando. Nolmy es una persona muy simpatica y esforzada en todo lo que hace. Ella esta muy feliz por la familia que tiene y se siente muy contenta porque cada dia Dios le provee su sustento diario. Nolmy a parte de ser una trabajadora asalariada tambien desde hace aproximadamente 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos. En su tiempo libre realiza sus ventas de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde reside pero su mejor clientela son sus compañeros y compañeras de trabajo ya que ella les vende al credito y cuando les cancelan la quincena en el trabajo ellos le pagan. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar todo tipo de cosmeticos para que las mujeres se embellezcan y luzcan radiantes, tambien comprará perfumes para damas y caballeros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra surtir su negocio y realizará mas ventas, y eso le permitirá obtener ganancias y con estas podra ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con los pagos de los estudios de sus hijos. Las metas de Nolmy son tener un negocio propio para no depender tanto de un sueldo asi pasar mas tiempo con su familia, tambien ver a sus hijos realizarse profesionalmente. Nolmy ya tiene dos ciclos en FAMA y ha demostrado puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Nolmy Aracely is 35 years old and her family is made up of her husband, involved in agricultural activities, and their daughter and son. They both attend school. Nolmy is a very likeable person who works hard in everything she does. She is very happy for the family that she has and she is very happy that every day God provides her with a daily sustenance. Nolmy has been a salaried employee for approximately 3 years and she also sells cosmetics. She carries out her sales in her spare time, traveling from door to door throughout the entire community where she lives. But her best clientele are her work colleagues. She completes her sales in credit and when they are paid every two weeks she gets paid. The loan which she requests will be used to purchase all types of cosmetics so that ladies can beautify themselves and become radiant. She will also purchase perfumes for ladies and gentlemen. With the support of the loan she will be able to supply her business and she will be able to increase her sales. She will be able to achieve greater earnings and in turn she will be able to help her husband with the household expenses and with their children's schooling costs. Nolmy's goal is to have a business of her own and to not have to depend so much on her salary so that she will be able to spend more time with her family. Her goal is also to see her children earn a career. Nolmy already has had two loan cycles with FAMA (Kiva Field Partner) and she has demonstrated punctuality with her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Bertila De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Bertila tiene 50 años de edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica a la Agricultura, tiene cuatro hijos varones y una hija mujer, y de todos sus hijos solo uno de ellos es dependiente de ella. Desde hace cuatro años Bertila se dedica a la venta de ropa americana de segunda mano y para eso a destinado una pequeña parte de su casa, pero tambien realiza ventas de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde reside. Su horario de atencion al cliente es desde las 7:00 am hasta que anochese y de vez en cuando su esposo y su hijo menor le ayudan a atender el negocio, y cuando eso sucede Bertila puede dedicarse a los quehaceres del hogar sin ninguna presion de tiempo, pero cuando no, ella tiene que levantarse muy temprano por la mañana para limpiar su casa. Ella esta solicitando este prestamo para surtir su negocio con la compra de varios fardos de ropa de segunda mano. Con el apoyo de este prestamo su negocio cambiara ya que el surtido de prendas de vestir para la temporada de lluvia le generará mas ventas y por tanto sus ganancias seran mejores. Su meta es tener un local propio para su negocio, ya que su casa es muy pequeña y con el negocio alli su espacio y el de su familia se ve reducido. Bertila tiene tres ciclos en FAMA y ha cancelado sus pagos de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Doña Bertila is 50 years old and married. Her husband is a farmer. They have four sons and a daughter. Of all her children, only one is still a dependent. Four years ago, Bertila began selling secondhand American clothes from a small area of her home. She also generated sales by going house-to-house throughout the entire community. Her schedule for attending to customers is from 7am until nightfall. Occasionally her husband and young son help look after the business, especially when she has to perform household chores because she does not have to worry about any time pressure. If they are not available, then she must wake up early in the morning to clean the house.

Bertila is requesting this loan to restock her business. She plans to buy several bundles of secondhand clothing. With the help of this loan, she will able to update her inventory of clothes with items for the rainy season. This will generate more sales and increase her income. Her goal is to have her own store for her business because her house is too small. The business requires space and it currently takes away too much from the family.

Bertila has participated in three loan cycles with FAMA and has completed her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: Doña Santos tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijas y de 1 hijo y reside en el Barrio La Ceiba, en el Municipio de La Union. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y en algunas ocasiones tambien vende cosmeticos y golosinas. Su mayor dificultad es su edad, ya que muy seguido le dan achaques, pero gracias a Dios tiene a su hija menor que depende de ella y ésta le ayuda a trabajar. Por las tardes van de casa en casa a vender la ropa y los cosmeticos, y por la tarde noche en frente de su casa colocan una mesita y empiezan a vender golosinas como pastelitos, yuca con chicharon, tajaditas de platano verde, entre otras. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar fardos de ropa usada para la temporada de lluvia, cosmeticos para que sus vecinas perfeccion su belleza e insumos para la preparacion de las golosinas. Con el apoyo de este prestamo Doña Santos podra seguir manteniendo sus negocios activos y esto le permitira seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos para sostenerse ella y su hija, y tambien podra tratarse medicamente. Su compañera de Grupo Ganiria Araceli se dedica a la venta de ropa. Doña Santos ha tenido varios prestamos en FAMA y ha pagado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 55 years old and a single mother with three daughters and a son. They reside in the neighborhood of La Ceiba in the town of La Union. She has been selling secondhand clothes for five years and on occasion she will also sell cosmetics and sweets. Her greatest difficulty is her age because she suffers from various ailments, but she thanks God that she has a young daughter who is able to help her with her work. In the afternoons, she goes from house-to-house to sell clothing and cosmetics. At night, she sets up a small table in front of her house and begins selling sweets such as miniature pastries, cassava and pork, green plantain chips, and other items.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bundles of used clothing for the rainy season, cosmetics that will help her neighbors achieve perfect beauty, and supplies for preparing sweets. With the help of this loan, Doña Santos can keep her businesses active. This will allow her to continue having a source of income to sustain herself and her daughter. She will also be able receive medical treatment.

Her fellow group member is Ganiria Araceli, who also sells clothing. Doña Santos has received several loans from FAMA and has completed her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy bundles of secondhand clothing.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es: El señor Gabriel es productor lechero; la leche la vende directamente a la empresa PIL Andina que es una fabrica industrializadora de productos lacteos; con ayuda de su familia también se dedica a al compra y venta de ganado en una feria del lugar semanalmente. El crédito lo requiere para  la compra de ganado (tanto una vaca lechera como un toro) así podrá aumentar la capacidad de producción y también ganado para la venta.  Viven en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Laja del  departamento de La Paz; es casado y tiene tres hijos. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito es canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Gabriel is a milk producer and sells his output directly to the PIL Andina Company, which has an industrial plant that processes dairy products. With the help of his family, he also buys and sells cattle at the fair on a weekly basis. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy cattle (one dairy cow and a bull) so that he can increase his production capacity and breed more animals to sell. Gabriel and his family live in their own home in the town of Laja in the Department of La Paz. He is married and has three children.

This is the first time that his loan has been referred to Kiva for funding.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and a bull for fattening and eventual resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a sack of onions, tomatoes and green vegetables.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a single man who owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is electricity bills.

For the past nine month he has operated business of driving a boda boda (motorcycle). His potential customers are passersby. He faces a major challenge of seasonality. Especially during rainy season, it becomes difficult for her to operate. He dreams of purchasing his own motorcycle in the future.

With the KES 15,000 he wants to renovate his house and purchase 1000 blocks. He decided to join Yehu to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to renovate his house and purchase 1000 blocks.

loans.name: Gualberto

texts.es: El señor Gualberto trabaja en la policía nacional y está destinado en la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para el acabado en obra fina de una habitación. Vive en casa de un familiar  ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es padre soltero  y tiene dos hijos. Con el crédito anterior pudo acabar otra habitación donde ahora sus hijos viven en mejores condiciones. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Gualberto works for the national police and is stationed in the city of La Paz.  The loan he is requesting will be used to finish a room.  He lives at a relative’s house in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz.  Gualberto is a single father and has two children.  With his previous loan,  he was able to finish another room and now his children live in better conditions.  

This is the second time he has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for materials and labor in order to finish a room.

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Maria, tiene 52 años, vive en la ciudad D. Concepción, ella está casada con el señor Julian, tienen 3 hijos todos ya son adultos, un varón y dos mujeres. La mayor ya se caso tiene su propia familia, el varón es policía y la otra hija está estudiando licenciatura en enfermería.
La señora tiene una pequeña granja donD. tiene sus vacas lecheras D. las cuales produce y venD. leche en su propia casa para el sustento y estudio D. sus hijos. Ella y su marido se iniciaron con una sola vaca hace más D. 20 años y poco a poco fueron creciendo hasta que hoy en día tienen más D. 17 vacas lecheras.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. balanceados y compra D. aparatos que van a ayudar para el tratamiento D. la leche. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 52 years old and lives in the city of Concepción. She is married to Sr. Julian and they have three children who are already adults, a son and two daughters. Her older daughter is married and has her own family. Her son is a police officer and her other daughter is studying for a nursing degree.

Sra. Maria has a small farm where she has dairy cows. She sells the milk they produce from her home in order to support her family and pay for her children’s education. Maria and her husband started out with only one dairy cow. More than 20 years later, they have steadily grown their business and now have more than 17 dairy cows.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy balanced feed and devices for treating milk. Maria is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and devices for treating milk.

loans.name: Kokou Edoh

texts.fr:
Kokou Edoh est un homme âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié å une commerçante et a 04 enfants. 
Kokou Edoh travaille comme imprimeur depuis 2004. Il sert ses clients dans un quartier de la place et achète les produits (intrants d’imprimerie) à LOME. 
Kokou Edoh a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter  des intrants d’imprimerie  pour accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Kokou Edoh is a 49-year-old father of four, married to a shopkeeper.  He has worked as a printer since 2004.  He serves his customers in a central neighborhood and buys his printing supplies in Lomé.

Kokou Edoh requested his first loan from WAGES to buy printing supplies in order to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy printing supplies.

loans.name: Salustio

texts.es: El señor Salustio trabaja en la policía nacional y también trabaja como electricista. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción, ya que realizara la construcción de gradas en su casa para tener un acceso más fácil y seguro al segundo piso de cu casa. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo ya que pudo mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Salustio ha estado construyendo su casa desde hace tiempo y ha solicitado créditos en IMPRO desde el año 2006, con un historial de pagos excelente.
texts.en:
Sr. Salustio is employed by the national police and also works as an electrician.  The loan he is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so that he can build a staircase, which will make it easier and safer to access the second floor of his house.  Salustio lives in his own home in the District of Las Lomas in the city of La Paz.  He is single and has no children.  

Salustio is very pleased with the loans he already received, which has allowed him to improve the conditions of his home.   He has been building his home for some time and has requested loans from IMPRO since 2006.  Salustio has an excellent payment history.

loans.use: to buy cement and stone for building a staircase in his house.

loans.name: Mwasabuni

texts.en:
Mwasabuni is a married man with two children. One attend school while the other one is still young for school. He lives at a rental house that has neither  electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mwasabuni has operated a scrap selling business, selling by wholesale to scrap metal dealers in the area. He faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in the market. Mwasabuni dreams of purchasing a motorcycle for a transport business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 loan, he wants to purchase scrap metals for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase scrap metals for resale.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario El Rosario está conformado por Manuel de Jesús, German francisco, Lucia del rosario, María Elena y Alba Maritza. Don German tiene 24 años es soltero y no tiene hijos él se dedica a la venta de nacatamales y elaboración de picadillo de cerdo. Desea en un futuro establecer la venta de comida en su vivienda lo fines de semana. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para compra de masa, cerdo, hojas y bolsas.
