El solicita el crédito para la compra sobrecamas, hamacas y demás para abastecer su stock de mercaderías con lo cual podrá hacer frente a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Francisco is 34 years old and has been married to Natalia for more than 9 years. He lives in his own house in the city of Carapeguá, and they have 2 school-age children.

More than 25 years ago he began to weave traditional hammocks and quilts, which he brings to sell in areas around Luque. He learned this trade from his father, as he worked in this field and taught him everything he knew.

Thanks to his work and effort he was able to buy himself two motorcycles which he uses to make his sales He currently travels in the company of his wife, and together they bring the handicrafts of the area to sell in various places.

They already have a well-established clientele who really like the products that they offer.  He says that he works hard to provide a good future for his children and his wife. 

He is seeking credit to buy quilts, hammocks and more to stock up on merchandise with which he will be able to meet his customers' demand.

loans.use: to buy quilts, hammocks and more for resale.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra , es una pequeña  agricultura de la zona rural del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder realizar mejoras a su humilde vivienda para sentirse más cómoda,  doña Sandra desde hace varios años se dedica a cultivar piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para un buena producción , actualmente el plantillo de piña  (su matas) esta de un mal color y la fruta muy pequeña por su edad . Con el financiamiento  lo va a invertir en fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar y así sacar un mejor cosecha .Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva .
texts.en: Sandra is a farmer in the rural part of Ticuantepe with her husband and children. Her plan for the future is to improve living conditions and do some home improvements to her humble abode to be a bit more comfortable.  Sandra has been farming pineapple for several years.  Her greatest challenge is not having the necessary supplies and fertilizer for a good production, which is currently pineapple (plants); they have poor color and the fruit is very small for its age.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and supplies to apply and improve the crops.  She is grateful for the support Afodenic has provided through Kiva funds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Siria

texts.es:
La señora Siria es D. la ciudad D. Encarnación, está casada con el Señor Ambrosio y comenta que son muy felices en su matrimonio.
Ella se dedica a al comercio hace ya 16 años, venD. todo tipo D. artículos como ser ropas, calzados y demás. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Ella se siente muy orgullosa D. lo que hace ya que es un trabajo digno y muy honesto. Sueña con poder tener un local propio donD. poder exhibir las mercaderías que venD.. Ella es una cliente recurrente D. la Fundación y ha cumplido D. forma satisfactoria con sus créditos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra D. ropas D. temporada D. invierno, con lo que podrá satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues D. obtener el crédito, este le será D. gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Siria is from the city of Encarnación. She's married to Ambrosio and says that they are very happily married. She has been in sales for 16 years and sells all kinds of items such as clothing, shoes etc. Thanks to her work, she has been able to support herself and her family. She feels very proud of what she does since it's dignified and honest work. She dreams of being able to own her own store where she can display the merchandise she sells. She is a repeat client of the Foundation and has repaid her loans in a satisfactory way.

She is requesting this loan so she can purchase winter clothing in order to meet her customers' demand. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity they are giving her. Receiving this loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for selling.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es: La señora Carmen Rosa D. 50 años es la presidente D. comité Camino al Éxito, hace 3 años ella integra este grupo, con 7 integrantes, todos se unieron con un propósito D. generar más ingresos para poder mantener a cada una D. sus familias, Carmen Rosa es casada y tiene 3 hijos, una D. ellas es independiente y los otros dos dependen D. ella y D. su esposo, ella tiene el negocio D. trabajos D. corospum  hace 6 años y con el tiempo ha prendido nuevas técnicas gracias a estudios y también a las revistas que tiene, con el esfuerzo D. ella y su esposo pagan los gastos D. su hogar, en el futuro ella quiere poner una pequeña empresa o un taller D. manualidades. Con el ultimo préstamo, piensa comprar materiales y herramientas.
texts.en:
Sra. Carmen Rosa is 50 years old and serves as president of the committee named “Camino al Éxito” (Road to Success).  She joined this group three years ago and now there are seven members.  They are all united in their goal of generating more income to maintain their families.  

Carmen Rosa is married and has three children, one daughter is independent and the other two are still dependent on her and her husband.  She has a business making items out of craft foam.  Carmen started this business six years ago and has implemented new techniques over time as a result of courses she has taken and magazines she has read.  Due to their efforts, Carmen and her husband have been able to pay their household expenses.  In the future, she hopes to open either a small store or a craft workshop.  

With this latest loan, Carmen plans to buy materials and equipment.

loans.use: to buy materials and equipment.

loans.name: Lyda Del Carmen

texts.es: Lyda de 48 años de edad vive con su esposo  y sus tres hijos en las edades de 14 a 20 años, en la ciudad de Cartagena donde se dedica a la venta de libros y también a la preparación de desinfectantes, champó y jabones líquidos;  Lyda inició su vida como negociante en un tenderete  y vendía minutos a celulares, y apoyada por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la cual ha recibido tres créditos, ha logrado ensanchar su mercado y adicionar  la venta de libros cristianos. Igualmente mediante capacitación aprendió la técnica para preparar desinfectantes, champó y jabones  y también se ha dedicado a ello.   Con su credikiva comprará materias primas para la preparación de jabones, desinfectantes y champó, fundamentado en un pedido, lo cual hará que  esta inversión sea exitosa, porque es un reto aumentar su capital de trabajo y esto es lo que la mueve cada día.
texts.en:
Lyda is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 14 and 20. They reside in the city of Cartagena, where she sells books and prepares disinfectants, shampoo, and liquid soaps. Lyda started her business working in a booth selling mobile phone minutes. With the support of three loans she received from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she was able to expand her market and add the sale of Christian books to her inventory. She also attended seminars where she learned techniques for preparing disinfectants, shampoo, and soaps. Lyda now engages in this business.

With this Kiva loan, she will buy raw materials for preparing soaps, disinfectants, and shampoo based on the orders that she receives. She hopes that this investment will be successful because her main challenge has been increasing her operating capital, which is what she needs to move forward each day.

loans.use: to buy materials for making disinfectants, shampoo, and soap.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es: Maruja es socia del Banco Comunal María De Los Angeles, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 3 ciclos, tiene 4 hijos y trabaja en artesanía al igual que su esposo, ellos compran piedras para poder tallarlas y también tienen un Stand en el Mercado de Artesanías, solicita un prestamo para invertir en su negocio, incrementar sus ventas y mejorar su negocio. Agradece a Finca Perú porque ha aprendido a ahorrar, las capacitaciones ayudaron para que pueda valorarse como mujer y ser mejor madre y esposa.
texts.en:
Maruja is a member of the Communal Bank “María de Los Ángeles”. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three loan cycles. Maruja has four children and works in a handicraft business alongside her husband. They buy stones to carve and also manage a booth at the craft market.

Maruja is requesting a loan to invest in her business so that she can make improvements and increase her sales. She is grateful to FINCA Peru because she has learned how to save. The training seminars have helped her to value herself as a woman and to become a better wife and mother.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Chester Danilo

texts.es: El señor Chester , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar a su papá , don  Chester desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña que junto a su padre lucha día a día para  llevar el pan a su vivienda , don Chester se siente muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva  ya que con estos financiamiento  inducen el cultivo de piña ,  dando como resultado una buena producción y logro vender el producto en un precio bueno , el cual obtuvo el  beneficio  de comprar una camionetita usada para trasladar su producto al mercado y no  tener que estar pagando para  sacar el producto de las tierras donde las siembran .
texts.en:
Sr. Chester is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions and to support his father. Don Chester has been growing pineapple for several years. He and his father strive each day to provide for the needs of their household.

Don Chester is very pleased with the support AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds. The loans have helped him with his pineapple crop, resulting in good production and the ability to sell his crop at a good price. With the profits he earned, he was able to buy a small used truck for transporting his product to market. He no longer has to pay someone to transport his crops once they have been harvested.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Las Magnificas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MAGNIFICAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ronualda. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de chocolates, venta de tucumanas, venta de cosméticos, venta de licores, venta de joyas, venta de celares, venta de refrescos 

La señora Romualda,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  por invitación de una de sus amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de tucumanas desde hace 25 años, después de haber estudiado repostería en la institución IBA.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de muebles (mesas) para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio alimento los cuales comprara de la Ceja y los ubicará en su lugar de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo.

En la fotografía podemos ver en el fondo, a la prima de una de nuestras socias que acompaña al grupo
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Magnificas” (The Magnificent Ones) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Exaltación Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Romualda. The members of this Communal Bank move forward in their various retail businesses selling products such as chocolates, turnovers, cosmetics, liquor, jewelry, mobile phones, and soft drinks.

Sra. Romualda says that this is the first time she joined Pro Mujer after being invited by one of her friends. At the moment, she has a business selling turnovers that she started 25 years ago after she finished studying pastry-making at the IBA Institute.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy furniture (tables) for improving the conditions of her business. She buys her ingredients in the neighborhood of La Ceja, which is located near her business. By working in this manner, Romualda is able to generate income to support her family as much as possible. She is married and has six children.

When asked what she enjoys about Pro Mujer, Romualda said she likes everything.

In the photograph, a cousin of one of the members appears with the group.

loans.use: to buy tables for her bakery.

loans.name: Omar De La Concepcion

texts.es: El señor  Omar , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe  , junto a su esposa e hijos , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para brindarles un mejor bienestar a su hijos , don Omar desde hace vaR. años labora en una casa privada , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no puede realizar de una sola vez la construcción de un cuarto ya que la casa donde habitan es muy pequeña  y casi esta todo junto por los espacios tan chiquitos ;   que si logra poner unos muebles no tiene espacio para caminar. El quiere el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción. Agradece Afodenic que atrávez de fondo Kiva  el apoyo que le brinda a las personas de bajos recursos para que logren realizar sus sueños de tener una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Sr. Omar is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe and lives with his wife and children. His plans for the future are to improve his living conditions and provide a better state of well-being for his children. For several years, Don Omar has worked for a private residence. His greatest difficulty has been not being able to make a one-time purchase of construction materials so that he can build a room in his house because right now it is very small. Due to the limited space, almost everything is occupied. There is hardly enough space to walk around and no room for additional furniture.

Omar needs this loan to buy construction materials. He is grateful to AFODENIC for providing Kiva funds. The support provided to people with limited resources enables them to achieve their dreams, such as having a decent home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Johanna

texts.es: Johanna es socia del Banco Comunal Los Olivos, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año, su mamá la invito, ella estudia Estomatología y ahora con los prestamos que recibe de Finca Perú logró tener su pequeño Laboratorio Dental y lo esta equipando, agradece mucho a Finca, porque ya no malgasta su dinero como antes sino que lo esta ahorrando todo para poder invertirlo en su laboratorio, ella esta muy agradecida a las capacitaciones ya que le ayudan en su vida cotidiana, su promotora le aconseja y siente que es su amiga.
texts.en:
Johanna is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Olivos” (The Olive Trees). This member joined FINCA Peru one year ago after she was invited by her mother. Johanna studied orthodontics and now the loans from FINCA Peru have helped her open and equip a small dental lab.

She is extremely grateful to FINCA Peru because she no longer squanders money like she did before. Everything she has saved has been invested into her laboratory. Johanna appreciates the training seminars, since they have helped her in her everyday life. Her loan officer advises her and treats her like a friend.

loans.use: to buy equipment for her dental laboratory.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
El señor Valentín nació en Samaipata casado con la Sra. Rosario con 5 hijos, el vive en Villa Florida donde tiene su parcela ellos viven y trabajan en esas tierras, ellos se dedican a la agricultura sembrando maíz, sandia, tomate, y también se dedica a la ganadería.    
El es cliente antiguo de la institución va sacando de Emprender como 7 créditos por la facilidad de pago y la comodidad de visita a domicilio por lo lejos de su vivienda, el paga todas sus cuotas sin atraso alguno, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra y la compra de semillas para la siembra de sandia.
texts.en:
Sr. Valentín was born in Samaipata and is married to Sra. Rosario. They have five children. He lives in Villa Florida, where he owns a parcel of land. Valentín lives and works on this land. He works as a farmer and grows corn, watermelon, and tomatoes. In addition, he raises cattle.

Valentín is a long-time client of Emprender who has received seven loans. He enjoys the convenient payments and being in the comfort of his home since he lives a long distance away. All of his payments have been submitted without delay. Valentín is a responsible and hardworking individual. The money from this loan will be used to prepare his land and to buy watermelon seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies for planting watermelon.

loans.name: Rocío Melisa

texts.es: Rocío es socia del Banco Comunal Belén, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace un año, trabaja en un taller donde confeccionan polos, entró a Finca Perú con la mentalidad de poder tener su taller propio, y ahora con este préstamo se comprara sus primeras máquinas para su taller, esta muy feliz por cumplir su sueño, agradece por todo lo que le enseñaron, sobre todo el ahorrar, le encantan las capacitaciones porque le ayudaron a poder fijarse metas y poder cumplirlas.
texts.en:
Rocío is a member of the Communal Bank “Belén” (Bethlehem). She has been a member of FINCA Peru for one year. Rocío works at a factory that makes polo shirts. She joined FINCA Peru with the intention of starting her own workshop.

Now that she has this loan, she will buy the first set of machines for her workshop. Rocío is very happy to fulfill her dream and is very grateful for everything she learned, most of all how to save. She enjoys the training seminars because they have helped her with establishing goals and accomplishing them.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for starting her own workshop.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: El señor Marcial, no es casado pero convive  con la señora Lenndy, desde hace 4 años, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y actualmente están dedicados a su emprendimiento de la confección de ropas, realizan chamarras, poleras, pantalón, variedad de prendas de vestir según a la temporada, para ello necesitaban el préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tela, hilo. Maquina cortadora de tela), el Sr. Marcial es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcial is not married, but has been in a relationship with Sra. Lenndy for the past four years. They have two children who are in school. He currently has a business making clothes such as jackets, sweatshirts, and a variety of other seasonal garments. Marcial needs a loan to buy raw materials, such as fabric and thread, and a cloth-cutting machine.

He is an enterprising individual who desires to succeed. Marcial appreciates the support that Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as fabric and thread, and a cloth-cutting machine.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia nacida en Chuquisaca vive con don Primitivo, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, ella tiene una parcela en Betanzoa 32 km de Limoncito el Torno donde vive y trabaja de la agricultura junto con su esposo y sus hijos y actualmente tiene otra parcela que compro con uno de los créditos que le dimos por que ella viene trabajando con Emprender hace 7 años pero a  su vez se dedica a la fabrica de carbón, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semilla y en lo que implica el preparado de la tierra para la siembra de Sandia y maíz, la señora julia comercializa sus productos en el mercado de la localidad directamente del productor al consumidor .
texts.en:
Julia was born in Chuquisaca.  She lives with Primitivo and has two children in her care.  She owns a piece of land in Betanzoa, 32 kilometers from Limoncito, El Torno, where she lives and works farming with her husband and children.  She also has another piece of land that she bought with one of the loans we gave her because she’s been working with Emprender for seven years.  At the same time, however, she also works making charcoal.

She will use the money from the loan to buy seeds and do the necessary tasks to prepare the soil to plant watermelon and corn.  Julia sells her products in the local market directly from producer to consumer.
.

loans.use: to buy seed and prepare the soil to plant watermelon and corn.

loans.name: Raquel De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Raquel, se dedica al negocio de taxi, junto con su esposo, siendo el cadete de taxi,  obteniendo mejores beneficios para su familia, dos hijos estudiantes.
Raquel ha venido mejorando su casa con ganancias y finanaciamiento que Afodenic ha dado en once ciclos, siendo de gran oportunidad para su familia, ya que son a plazos y ha logrado equilibrar sus gastos.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la construccion de un cuarto al lado de su casa y asi poder obtener mejor espacio para su hija, pues ha venido anexando el cuarto, hizo el baño y que espera avanzar bastante ahora con esta construccion. El cual comprara materiales de construccion en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, piedrin, laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura entre otros materiales que ayude ah realizar la obra.
texts.en:
Raquel works in taxi services with her husband, who is the driver. This way, they earn more income for their family, including two children in school.

Raquel has been making housing improvements using her income and eleven loans granted by AFODENIC in cycles. This has been a great opportunity for her family, as the loans are in installments and they have been able to balance their finances. This new loan will be for the construction of a room next to the house to create a better living space for her daughter. She has been working on adding the room and installed the bathroom, and she hopes to now make significant progress in construction. As a result, she will buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement, iron, gravel, zinc metal sheeting, beams, screws and solder, among other materials useful for the project.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a room on the side of her house so that her youngest daughter is more comfortable.

loans.name: Luz De Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Dionicia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tienda de barrio, venta de ollas, venta de productos de curación, venta de comida, carpintería, electricista, costura de chamarras.
 
La señora Dionicia,  indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por invitación de la asesora de credito. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería que viene trabajando hace siete años, aprendiendo el mismo de su papá. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de Rio Seco (lugar comercial de la ciudad de El Alto)  y posteriormente elaborado los productos los venderá en la feria 16 de Julio. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta crédito, salud y ahorros.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank, “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE”, will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of Centro Collpani.  The communal bank is composed of eight members and is headed by a board led by Dionicia.  The community association members work in businesses that are varied, among them are: grocery, cookware sales, healing products sales, food vending, carpentry, electrician, jacket tailoring.
 
Dionicia indicates that this is the first time Pro Mujer integrated income at the invitation of the credit counselor. Today, Dionicia has a carpentry business that she has been working at for seven years.  She learned the same business as her dad.

Dionicia will use the loan to raise capital (to purchase wood) that she will acquire at Rio Seco (place of business in the city of El Alto).  She will later sell the finished products at the fair on July 16. This workflow allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she lives with her partner and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Dionicia replies that she likes the loans, health and savings.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana, es una pequeña agricultura del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida  y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a  sus hijos para que sean unas personas de bien, doña Ana desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden la plantación ya que estas  carece de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para combatir malezas, Agradece Afodenic que atrávez de los fondo Kiva , los agricultores reciban este beneficio  , para que puedan continuar trabajando .
texts.en: Ana is a small farmer from the Municipality of Ticuantepe.  Together with her family, her future plan is to improve their living conditions and to always support her children’s education so that they become good people.  Ana has working growing pineapple for several years.  The most difficult thing she faces are the pests that invade the fields, as they lack fertilizer and other necessary supplies to fight off weeds.  She is grateful to AFODENIC which, through Kiva, grants these loans to farmers so that they can continue working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes Zenobia

texts.es: Lourdes es socia del Banco Comunal Belén, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace mas de 5 años, ella tiene una camioneta donde lleva abarrotes a distritos de Ayacucho, ella conoció a la Morenita (Fundadora de FINCA Perú) la admira mucho por todo lo que le enseñó, tuvo una mala experiencia porque le robaron todo su dinero y no tenia ni para comer, pudo recurarse, ahora esta ahorrando, Finca Perú le ayudó a salir adelante y seguir progresando, le gusta mucho la puntualidad tanto el horario como en sus pagos.
texts.en: Lourdes is a member of the Belen community bank, a Finca Peru partner for more than 5 years.  She owns a truck that she uses to haul groceries around Ayacucho.  She met La Morenita (the founder of Finca Peru), a woman she greatly admires because of what she's learned from her.  She had a bad experience when she was robbed of all her money and was left with nothing, not even for food.  She recovered and now she's saving.  Finca Peru is helping her to support herself and get ahead in the world.  For her, punctuality is a virtue, as important for repaying this loan as it is for everday reasons.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle for a delivery business.

loans.name: Reriman

texts.en:
Reriman is 45 years old. She lives in Kartal, a small district in İstanbul. She is married and has three children. The oldest one is 21 and the youngest one is 13 years old.

She has been working as a tailor in Kartal for 24 years. Also, she is selling fabric at her store. When she started her business years ago she had only two machines. During these years she has managed to increase them to three. She also has another store just for selling fabric.

With the help of the loan she will get from Maya, she is planning to increase the types of fabric in her store. She will both provide tailoring services and sell fabric to her customers.

She wants to develop her business to earn more money. She wants to help her children get a better education.

Reriman is a self-confident, hardworking, passionate woman.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Reriman 45 yaşında.İstanbul'un Kartal semtinde yaşıyor.Evli ve 3 çocuğu var.En büyüğü 21 ,en küçüğü 13 yaşında. 
Kartalda terzi dükkanı var, aynı zamanda dükkanda kumaş da satıyor.Reriman hanım 24 yıldır bu işi yapıyor.İşe başladığında 2 tane makinası varmış,zamanla bu makina sayısını üçe çıkarmış.Daha sonra sadece kumaşlarını sattığı bir dükkan daha açmış.Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile kumaş çeşidini arttıracak.Dikiş diktirmek isteyen kadınlara kumaş satıp aynı zamanda dikişini de yapacak.
Reriman Hanım işini daha da büyütüp,çocuklarına gelecekte iyi eğitim aldırmak istiyor.Reriman Hanım,kendine güvenen,çalışkan ve hırslı bir kadın.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus Group

texts.es: Dalia Carolina tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos y junto a ellos reside en el Barrio Concepcion en el Departamento de La Paz. Doña Dalia inició su actividad laboral desde muy temprana edad ya que ayudaba a su madre a vender elotes y algunos productos derivados de este como el atol y los tamalitos, luego de unos años se dedicó a vender Loteria. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos de puerta en puerta. Su vida no ha sido nada facil, en parte porque sus hijos estan estudiando y su ex-esposo no le ayuda con los gastos escolares a penas y le da para la alimentacion de ellos y a parte de eso como realiza sus ventas al credito algunos de sus clientes y clientas le han quedado mal con los pagos. Con el prestamo que está solicitando comprará shampoos, desodorantes, fragancias, peines, cremas, jabones, barniz de uñas, sombras, listicks, entre otros. Con el apoyo de este prestamo surtira de mas productos su negocio y asi podra ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad. Su mayor desafio es que recorre grandes distancias para poder vender sus productos. Sus metas son ayudar a sus hijos a culminar sus estudios y ser una distribuidora de cosmeticos autorizada en la zona. Sus compañeras de grupo Francisca y Adela, se dedican a la venta de golosinas y de cuajada. Este es el primer ciclo para el Grupo y esperan cumplir con puntualidad los pagos.
texts.en: Dalia Carolina, 34, is a single mother with two children.  She lives in Concepcion, a town in the "departamento" of La Paz.  She started working very young because she had to help her mother with various businesses: first, food sales and, later, sales of lottery tickets.  Dona Dalia now makes a living selling cosmetics door to door.  Her life isn't easy, partly because her children are in school and her former husband barely helps with school fees and other expenses, and partly because she sells on credit and her customers don't always pay on time.  She will use this loan to buy shampoos, deodorants, perfumes, combs, creams, soaps, nail varnish, eye shadow, lipsticks and other inventory.  The loan will help her stock her business so that she can provide a wider range of products to her customers.  Her biggest challenge is the distances she has to travel to sell her products.  Her goals are to see her children finish school and to be an authorized cosmetics distributor in her neighborhood.  Her fellow group members, Francisca and Adela, operate retail businesses, selling snacks and dairy products.  This is the group's first round of funding and they expect to repay their loans in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Yolima

texts.es: Yolima de 29 años vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia con su esposo, donde se dedica a la venta en volumen de hielo y boli; negocio que surgió justamente observó la gran demanda de los habitantes de este municipio, que posee  vocación turística, por estar ubicado a la orilla del mar y provisto de playas, que albergan a su alrededor negocios como restaurantes y muchos vendedores ambulantes y que por su cálido clima, sus habitantes y turistas buscan refrescarse continuamente para calmar su sed, especialmente en los meses de verano, época en la cual se impactan mayormente este tipo de ventas. Sus principales clientes son los vendedores al detalle que no tienen neveras y suelen enfriar sus refrescos con hielo y le siguen en su estructura de compradores los restaurantes. Como Yolima es una joven consciente de la oportunidad, también vende mercancías variadas, como blusas, zapatos, pantalones y accesorios femeninos que compra en la ciudad de Barranquilla y los distribuye entre sus clientes en el municipio mediante plazos de pago adaptados a sus necesidades, facilitando que sus clientes puedan acceder a las mercancías que necesitan, para pagar en varias partidas. Su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para hacer crecer ambos negocios, el primero ya requiere un congelador y el segundo exige responder a su creciente clientela que solicitan mercancías variadas a Yolima y es muy difícil ser oportuna. Esta es la razón de aplicar a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará un congelador y ropa femenina y accesorios femeninos. Porque su sueño y gran desafío es crecer, hasta convertirse en la mayor distribuidora de su municipio. Mientras esto ocurre, Yolima trabaja persistentemente en su negocio con un margen de contribución del 80% y con sus inventarios rotando cada 3 días.
texts.en:
Yolima is 29 years old and lives in the town of Puerto Colombia with her husband.  She sells ice in bulk and "boli" (flavored water in small plastic bags).  This business came about as she observed great demand by the inhabitants of this municipality.  The area has tourist potential, being located by the sea and beaches.  It is also home to businesses such as restaurants and many vendors.  The area is also known for its warm climate, so inhabitants and tourists alike continually seek to cool off and quench their thirst, especially in the summer months,which is a major impact on sales.  Yolima's main customers are vendors who do not have refrigerators and often cool their drinks with ice for restaurants to purchase.

As Yolima is a young woman who is aware of opportunity, she also sells general merchandise such as shirts, shoes, pants and accessories for women. She buys the items in the city of Barranquilla and distributes them to her customers in the municipality by payment terms tailored to their needs.  She enables her customers to access the goods they need by allowing them to pay in several payments.  Her working capital is not enough to grow both businesses; the first requires a freezer and the second requires responding to her growing clientele seeking a variety of goods, and it is very difficult for Yolima to be timely. 

This is the reason why Yolima is applying for a loan with Kiva and this is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to buy a freezer and women's clothing accessories.  Her dream and challenge is to grow and become the largest distributor in her municipality.  Until this happens, Yolima will work persistently in her business with a contribution margin of 80% and inventories rotating every 3 days.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and women's clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge , es habitante del municipio de Masaya , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y comprar una casita para dejársela a sus hijos y que no anden rodando de casa en casa , don Jorge desde hace varios años se dedica a la reparación de parlantes , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no cuenta con un recurso disponible (capital ) para poder expedirse  mas el negocio ya que en ocasiones  sus clientes le piden que si puede mejorar la apariencia del cajón de los parlante , retocando un poco la pintura  ; lo cual por problemas de materia  prima y herramienta dice que no . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondo Kiva , para seguir creciendo en su negocio .
texts.en:
Jorge lives in Masaya with his family.  His future plan is to improve living conditions and to buy a small house to leave to his children so that they won’t be going from house to house.  

Jorge has been repairing speakers for several years.  The greatest difficulty he faces is not having  a disposable resource (capital) to expand more in the business since on occasion customers ask him to improve the appearance of the speaker box, retouching the paint a bit, but because of the lack of raw materials and tools he has to say no.  He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides through Kiva funds to continue growing in business

loans.use: to buy parts for speaker repair.

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: Lelis D. 47 años D. edad se dedica a L. actividad comercial en su casa ubicada al suroccidente D. L. ciudad, donD. vive con sus 4 hijos en las edades D. 20 a 24 años. Procedente D. Aracataca, desD. muy niña llegó a L. ciudad D. BarranquilL., donD. formó su familia y desD. hace 6 años se separó D. su cónyuge y asumió las riendas D. su hogar, pues desD. hace 21 años ya era trabajadora independiente, vendía mercancías variada y también bebidas. Su negocio D. mercancía lo distribuye en los municipios del departamento del Magdalena donD. tiene su principal clienteL.,  a quienes les venD. ropa, cosméticos, perfumes y artículos que le solicitan, especialmente cuando se acercan las fiestas patronales y eventos que conglomeran muchos potenciales clientes. Su negocio D. venta D. bebidas, lo desarrolL. todos los días, los fines D. semana aumentan sus ventas, pues  usualmente son  épocas D. pago D. nóminas, quincenas o décadas. En L. actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con L. cual comprará, bebidas en mayor volumen, así como ropa que tiene encargada y accesorios femeninos, con ello ganaría descuentos por las compras en mayor volumen y D. contado y aquí radica el éxito D. su inversión. Su sueño más adelante es tener una casa donD. pueda adecuar su negocio en un espacio confortable para elL. su familia y que los clientes se sientan muy bien atendidos por L. comodidad que este lugar le inspire. Mientras todo esto ocurre, Lelis se esmera en su negocio diariamente por aumentar sus ventas, y por sostener su rentabilidad que no es menor del 17,79%, rotación D. inventarios D. 17 días en L. mercancía y en las bebidas, diaria. Su máximo sueño es ver a sus hijos felices en familia y con mucho bienestar.
texts.en:
Lelis, 47, conducts her commercial activity from home which is located in the southwest part of the city where she lives with her four children whose ages range from 20 to 24 years.  She is from Aracataca having arrived as a little girl in BarranquilL. where she eventually formed her family.  Six years ago she separated from her spouse and took on the reins of her household since she has been an independent merchant for the last 21 years selling assorted merchandise and beverages.

She sells her merchandise in towns in Magdalena Department where her main clientele is located.  She sells them clothes, cosmetics, perfumes and other items they request especially when the patron saint feast days or other events approach that gather together lots of potential customers. The beverage sales take place every day and sales rise on weekends because that’s usually when salaries are paid (biweekly or every ten days).

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that she’ll use to buy larger amounts of beverages as well as clothes she has on order and women’s accessories.  She will earn discounts buying in volume and paying cash and this is where her investment’s success resides.

Her future dream is to have a house where she can set up her business in a space that’s comfortable for her and her family and where customers will feel well cared for due to the comfort the place inspires.  While all this occurs, Lelis strives daily in her business to increase sales to maintain her profit margin which is no less than 17.79%, a stock turnover rate of 17 days for the merchandise and daily for the beverages.  Her main dream is to see her children happy as family with much wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy beverages in larger amounts.

loans.name: Ramiro Jose

texts.es: El señor Ramiro , es agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Ramiro desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden las plantas y en ocasiones el robo del producto  , los planes que tiene hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo y obtener mayor ingresos  , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva ya que son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas de apoyo ya que le brinda asistencia técnica para desarrollarse mejor como un pequeño comerciante de piña .
texts.en:
Ramiro’s a farmer in Ticuantepe with his family.  His future plan is to improve living conditions.  Ramiro has been farming pineapples for several years.  The greatest challenge he faces is the infestations that invade his plants and sometimes the theft of product.  The plan he has for his crops is to diversify them and earn higher income.  

He is grateful for the support Afodenic provides through Kiva funds because there are a lot of farmers who benefit from these support programs because they provide technical assistance to develop better as small merchants of pineapples.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sewing supplies and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: La señora Virginia y su esposo el señor Esteban llevan muchos años de casado, ellos viven en la zona de Mapaizo, cuentan con casa propia en la cual viven con sus cuatro hijos , dos de ellos ya son mayores  y trabajan de manera independiente, los otros dos siguen estudiando en colegio. La señora Virginia llego a nuestra oficina por referencia de su hermana, Doña Virginia se dedica al comercio de ropa y sabanas de manera ambulante en diferentes localidades  como Monteagudo, Mairana, Padilla, etc. Su marido viaja con ella, el cual se dedica también a la venta de ropa interior, la señora Virginia también tiene dos motos propias, las cuales son sus dos hijos mayores los que la trabajan de moto taxi en la zona y le dan renta diaria, el financiamiento es para la compra de mercadería ropa de temporada, ella viaja hasta  Oruro a comprar su mercadería.
texts.en: Virginia and her husband Esteban have been married for many years and live in the Mapaizo area in their own home with their four children. Two of them are grown and work independently and the other two are still studying at school. Virginia discovered Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) through her sister. Virginia sells clothing and sheets in different places such as Monteagudo, Mairana, Padilla, etc. Her husband travels with her and sells underwear. Virginia also has two motorbikes which belong to her two older children who use them for their motortaxi business so they can earn daily income. The loan will be used to buy seasonal clothing. Virginia will travel to Oruro to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing

loans.name: Elvia Margarita

texts.es: Doña Elvia tiene 37 años de edad, su familia esta integrada por su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y ganaderia, y sus tres hijos de los cuales dos son mujeres. Ella es una persona muy simpatica y muy orgullosa de sus tres hijos porque son muy buenas personas y muy buenos estudiantes. Elvia inició con su pequeña pulperia en el 2005 y le dio el nombre de Pulperia Gerson, la cual atiende desde las 7:00 am hasta la tarde-noche. Su mayor ventaja es que no hay mas pulperias en la comunidad y sus vecinos realizan las compras diarias en su negocio, aunque ultimamente sus ventas han bajado ya que cada dia los productos de la canasta basica son mas caros. El prestamo que Doña Elvia solicita lo necesita para la compra de arroz, manteca, embutidos, lacteos, refrescos, azucar, frijoles, dulces, pan, churros, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra surtir de mas y variados productos y con ello sus clientes siempre encontraron lo que necesitan. Su meta es apoyar a sus hijos con el estudio, aunque siente un poco de temor de que al graduarse no encuentren un empleo, asi que espera que ellos se decidan a tener un negocio propio al igual que ella. Este es el primer ciclo de Doña Elvia en FAMA y espera cumplir de manera puntual el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Elvia is 37 years old and her family consists of her husband who works in agriculture and with livestock, and her three children, 2 of whom are females.  She is a very caring person and proud of her three children because they are good people and good students.  Elvia started her small store in 2005 and named it Gerson Store which operates from 7AM until dusk.  Her greatest advantage is that there are no other convenience stores in the community and her neighbors carry out their daily shopping at her store.  Ultimately, her sales have dropped due to the daily increasing cost of staple goods.  Elvia solicits a loan to purchase: rice, lard, sausages, milk, soft-drinks, sugar, beans, sweets, bread, and churros amongst other things.  By having support from the loan she can then stock more and varied products which will allow her customers to always find what they need.  Her goal is to help her children with school although she fears they may not be able to find employment upon graduation which is why she hopes they establish a business of their own just like her.  This is Elvia's first loan with FAMA and she expects to make punctual payments.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in general

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es: El Sr.  José se dedica a trabajar como albañil contratista desde hace quince años cuenta con todas las herramientas de trabajo necesarias para dicha actividad, pero necesita comprar una mezcladora de mayor capacidad ya que la obra que agarro en contrato es grande, actualmente vive en domicilio de su propiedad junto a su esposa y su hijo, tiene el deseo de superarse  en todo sentido razón por la que esta invirtiendo en la compra de la mezcladora, es una persona muy trabajadora.
texts.en:
José has worked as a contracted bricklayer for 15 years.  He has all of the necessary tools to do this work, but he needs to buy a mixer with greater capacity.  The job that he got by contract is big.

He currently lives in his own house with his wife and his son.  He wishes to excel in everything.  That is the reason that he is investing in the purchase of a mixer.  He is a very hard-working person.

loans.use: to buy a cement mixer.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: La señora Paula, es habitante del municipio de la Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y mejorar su vivienda, doña Paula desde hace varios años se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado de Managua , ya que con estos ah logrado mantener a su familia , doña Paula cuenta solo con su capital de trabajo y no le ajusta para la compra de zinc , perlines ,  clavos , etc. , para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que en tiempos de lluvia entra por todos lados el agua ya que está bien maltratado el zinc por los años de uso que lleva , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para que pueda compra los materiales que necesita para realizar la obra .
texts.en:
Paula lives with her husband and children in the Concepción Masaya municipality.  Her plans for the future are to improve their living conditions and improve her house.

Paula has been selling fruit and vegetables at the Managua market for several years.  This has been the way that she has managed to support her family.  

Paula only has her working capital, and it does not cover the purchase of zinc sheeting, beams, and nails, etc.  These items are to change the roof of her house because when it rains water comes in everywhere.  The zinc sheeting is in very bad condition because of how old it is.

She is grateful for the support from Afodenic through a Kiva loan.  With the loan she will be able to buy the materials she needs to do the job.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Iris Del Socorro

texts.es: Iris vive en el municipio de Soledad con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en las edades de 10 a 25 años. Allí se dedica al oficio de la confección y también vende mercancías variadas, como ropa interior y exterior femenina, colonias, perfumes cremas y accesorios. Su necesidad personal de generar ingresos, fueron sus principal motor para desarrollar esta actividad de manera independiente y poder apoyar la gestión de su hogar. Iris maneja otra actividad con lo que complementa sus ingresos que ofrece los servicios de enfermería, actividad en la cual se encuentra capacitada para hacerlo. Su credikiva es el séptimo financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  organización con la cual tiene 12 años de estar vinculada; con él  comprará telas, hilos, botones, broches, correderas, pellones, colonias, perfumes, brasieres, suéteres, bermudas, chancletas, para continuar su crecimiento y expansión en el mercado.  Con el apoyo de la Fundación Iris ha logrado cambiar su forma de vida, pues mejoró sus ingresos, aplicando a sus créditos toda su fuerza de trabajo y disciplina. Su meta más adelante es organizar locativamente su taller en su vivienda y ampliar la miscelánea., pero su gran desafío es que su creciente clientela, le hacen sentir como su capital es insuficiente para responder a sus expectativas.  Mientras tanto, Iris trabaja persistentemente, logrando obtener un aumento 38% en sus ganancias, lo cual ha permitido la reinversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Iris lives in the municipality of Soledad with her ​​husband and 5 children aged between 10 and 25 years old.  She works there making clothes, and also selling various goods such as underwear and outerwear for women, colognes, perfumes, lotions and accessories.  The main driver for her developing this activity independently was her personal need for income and to be able to support her household.  Iris manages another activity that supplements her income; she provides nursing services, an activity which she is capable of doing.

This Kiva loan is the seventh loan that she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization which she has been involved with for 12 years.  With it, she will purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, snaps, zips, interfacing, colognes, perfumes, bras, sweaters, shorts, and flip flops, to continue her growth and expansion in the market. 

With the support of the Foundation, Iris has succeeded in changing her way of life as well as improving her income, by applying her entire work ethic and discipline to the loans.  Her goal for later on is to set up her workshop in her home and expand the amount of miscellaneous items she offers.  But her big challenge is her growing customer base, which makes her feel like her capital is insufficient to meet their expectations. 

Meanwhile, Iris works consistently, achieving a 38% increase in profits which has allowed her to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, snaps, zips, interfacing, colognes, perfumes, bras, sweaters, shorts, and flip flops,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken and feed.

loans.name: Marily

texts.es:
Marily con su nuevo credikiva comprará insumos para sus comidas como arroz, aceite, y tembien surtirá su negocio con accesorios para celulares modernos; ella está muy agradecida con el préstamo ya que cada ingreso que tiene, le genera posibilidades de aumentar su capital de trabajo y con ello apoyar el desempeño de su familia, especialmente en lo concerniente a la educación de sus hijos. Con su credikiva anterior le fue muy bien y esto la entusiasma. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Marily ingrese al siguiente enlace: 


http://kiva.org/lend/210269
texts.en: With her new credikiva Marily will buy supplies such as rice and oil for her meals and she will also supply her business with modern accessories for cell phones. She is very grateful for the loan as any income she receives creates opportunities to increase her working capital, thus supporting her family and especially the education of her children. She did very well with her previous credikiva and she is full of enthusiasm. If you would like to read Marily’s story click on the following link: Business 210269

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice and oil for her meals and also to supply her business with modern accessories for cell phones.

loans.name: Juan Rene

texts.es: Don René tiene 41 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, es padre de cuatro hijos, pero solo tres de ellos se dedican a estudiar, y el cuarto de sus hijos perdió la vida. Don René tiene un negocio de Fotocopiado y tambien vende ropa interior para hombres y mujeres. Su negocio no tiene nombre y trabaja de forma individual. El oficio lo aprendió observando el centro de fotocopiado de la Escuela Primaria donde tambien trabaja como Maestro de Educacion. Por las mañanas por mientras él da clases en la escuela su esposa le ayuda a atender el negocio y por la tarde lo hace él. Sus metas son criar a sus hijos de manera tal que sean personas productivas y honestas, y para su negocio desea que crezca e ir lo convirtiendo en un ciber cafe para que este le genere mas ganancias y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor vida economica. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar toner para la fotocopiadora, papel tamaño carta, oficio y legal, asi como lapices, folders, entre otros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra mantener activo su negocio y eso significa una fuente extra de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. Algunos de sus desafios son que vive en una zona rural y debe vender sus productos a un costo muy bajo y que tiene bastante competencia. Este es el segundo prestamo de Don René en FAMA y ha cancelado sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Don Rene is 41 years old, is married and his wife is in charge of taking care of their home.  He is father to four children, only three of them are going to school, the fourth lost his life.  Don Rene has a business making copies and also sells underwear for men and women.  His business does not have a name and he works by himself.  He learned the trade while observing the photocopy center of the elementary school where he also works as a teacher.  In the mornings, while he is teaching at the school his wife takes care of the business, and in the afternoons he takes it over.  His goals are to raise his children in a way that they become productive and honest individuals, and to continue growing his business and eventually convert it to a cybercafe, this way increasing his income and being able to give his family a better life.  The loan that he is requesting is for buying toner for his photocopy machines, letter and legal sized paper, pencils, folder and other such items.  With the support from the loan, he will be able to continue his business which provides an additional source of income for the support of his family.  Some of his challenges are that he lives in a rural area and his products sell a lower prices and also that he has a fair amount of competition.  This is the second loan for Don Rene with FAMA and he has paid his installments on time.

loans.use: Purchase toner and paper.

location.town: San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho

loans.name: Evelyn Milena

texts.es:
Evelyn Milena es una señora de 26 años de edad quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.
Ella tiene como herramienta de trabajo su camión y brinda sus  servicios a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.
Actualmente dona Evelyn está solicitando un microcrédito de 500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de repuestos para mejora de su camión además de ampliar y reforzar su local.
Con esta inversión espera que su proyecto crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores servicio. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Dona Evelyn es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Evelyn Milena is 26 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a small community called Trinchera de Pital located in the Alajuela province.  The principal activities in this area are raising cattle and farming, it is known for its pineapple crop, which is sold mainly in the international markets.  Because of this, the development of this community has been increasing in the last years  thus increasing the demand of products and generating more opportunities for work. 
Her truck is her work tool and she provides her services to the neighbors in the community which are very satisfied with the quality of her work.
Evelyn is currently requesting a micro loan of 500,000 colones for the purchase of parts to repair her truck and also to enlarge and reinforce her premises.
With these investments she expects to grow her project and be able to better serve her customers.  All of this will help to improve her quality of life.
Dona Evelyn is a member of the Community Venture of Successful Women of Trinchera de Pital, one of the 110 organization members of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This is her first loan and with this she expects to continue growing both personally and financially, and also actively participate in the credit organization in her community.

loans.use: to purchase parts for the improvement of her truck.

loans.name: Yolanda Hernestina

texts.es: Yolanda a sus 53 años ve con satisfacción el fruto del arduo trabajo realizado, vive en su casa con el menor de sus 4 hijos.Tiene su tienda de abarrotes desde hace 3 años que instalo en su misma casa, sus hijos que la visitan con frecuencia la apoyan en la atención y ofrece a su clientela variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Ella atiende su negocio mayormente por las mañanas ya que por las tardes tiene otras ocupaciones. Los días jueves de cada de semana se abastece de mercadería en otro negocio de carne que tiene ya que compra mercadería en carne, queso y  algunas cosechas de la zona rural y lleva a vender a sus cliente de manera ambulante los días sábados. Yolanda manifiesta que lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que  puede ver sus ganancias de manera diaria y para el futuro su deseo es incrementar su capital.Esta es la séptima solicitud de crédito y trabajo financiero que tiene con MFP de las cuales  siente la gran satisfacción de pertenecer a un banco comunal unido y muy cumplido en el pago de sus cuentas que le genera tranquilidad y confianza de saber que esta rodeada de personas honestas Y en esta ocasión comprara mas mercadería para su tienda
texts.en: Yolanda is 53 years old and is pleased that her hard work is paying off.  She lives with the youngest of her 4 children.  3 years ago she set up her small shop in her home.  Her children visit often and help her with the business, providing good service and a variety of every day necessities.  Yolanda works in her store primarily in the mornings, as in the afternoons she has other responsibilities.   On Thursdays each week, she buys meats and cheeses and products from local harvests in another market, and brings them to sell to her clients on the weekends.   What Yolanda likes about her work is that she can see her income every day.  In the future she would like to increase her income.   This is the 7th loan she has had with MFP and she feels very pleased to be a member of this communal bank, as it gives her a sense of confidence to work with a group of honest people.   She will use the loan to purchase merchandise for  her store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise for her small shop

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – вдова. Она живет в небольшом городе, где имеет свой бизнес – торгует на рынке подростковой обувью и одеждой. Людмила занимается этим бизнесом уже 19 лет. Ей нравится обслуживать клиентов, помогать им выбирать подходящую обувь и одежду. Людмила выбирает качественный товар, который будет долго носиться и радовать покупателей.

Людмила просит выдать кредит в сумме 12,000 гривен на приобретение товара к осеннему школьному сезону. Она надеется увеличить продажи, а полученную прибыль потратить на благоустройство своего жилья.
texts.en: Ludmila is a widow. She lives in a small town, where for the last nineteen years she has sold teen clothing and shoes on the market. She enjoys assisting customers; helping them pick out clothing that fits. She acquires high-quality goods that wear long and are a joy to buyers. Ludmila is asking for a loan in order to purchase goods for the upcoming school season. She hopes to increase her sales and fix up her home with the profits.

loans.use: to buy additional sales goods for the school season.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is married with a grown son. She sells women’s clothing and footwear in her home town of Novaya Kahovka. Natalya launched her trade due to financial struggles many years ago. She managed to survive all the challenges of perestroika and the unfavorable economic climate back in the '90s in Ukraine. Natalya developed her business well. Currently she has two sales locations with 30,000 Grivnyas in monthly sales. 

Natalya is planning to invest the loan of 15,000 Grivnyas in additional merchandise. She is hoping to improve the selection of inventory she offers for sale in her kiosks, thus attracting even more customers to her business. The profits generated will be used to meet her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to improve her product range

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a businessman who sells mobile phone accessories to earn a living. He started the business ten years ago and he has employed two people.  He has been trained in business management by Faulu Kenya. This has helped him to improve his business. 
Benson hopes to own permanent business premises in the future to save on rental fees. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 34 years old, married and has three children. For four years he has been operating a van transport business. He has employed one person to assist him in the business. He left his job and went into business so that he could earn a better income for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his business.
Samuel hopes to buy two more vans for more income generation. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a new engine for his van.

loans.use: To buy an engine for his van

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 28 years old and married with four children. She has been operating a grocery store for five years. She is grateful to Faulu Kenya for giving her a loan which she used as capital to start her business.  
Naomi hopes to grow her business into a wholesale business in the future. She has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 33 years old and married with three children. He has been a mechanic for four years. He also operates a retail shop for more income generation.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access financial resources which have helped him to grow his business.
Paul hopes to expand his business and open up his own garage in the future. He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy a welding machine, grinder, drill and buffing machine.

loans.use: To buy a welding machine, grinder, drill and buffing machine.

loans.name: Anjelina

texts.en:
Anjelina is 54 years old and a single mother of three. She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from selling bags. In addition, she does outside catering for more income generation.  
Anjelina has been operating her businesses for three years and has employed two people to assist her.
Anjelina has benefited from Faulu Kenya, which has helped empower her economically. She hopes to own a business premise so as to save on rental fees. She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy utensils for her catering business and children's bags to sell.

loans.use: To buy utensils for her catering business and children's bags to sell.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda lives in Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and works seven days out of every week. 
Cotilda sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges include the ever-increasing price of clothes and the seasonality of her sales. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second-hand clothes and also to be a wholeseller. 
Cotilda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and running water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah lives in Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom go to school. Deborah sells second hand clothes. She has been in this business for 8 years and she works 7 days a week. Deborah sells her products retail at the market. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenges for Deborah include transportation and seasonality.  Her goal is to start importing second hand clothes. Deborah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (three nephews and nieces). 
Rosemary has a business of selling African batiks and clothing. She has been in this business for eight years, and works six days out of every week.  Rosemary sells her products in a retail shop. Rosemary has requested for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy rolls of fabric (batticks and other cloth). 
She generates additional income through a pub. Rosemary's main business challenges include bad debtors, thieves and seasonality of her sales. Her goals and aspirations for the business are to buy sewing machines to make designs and also to own a tailoring school. 
Rosemary lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of baticks and other African cloth.

loans.name: Sumiini

texts.en:
Sumiini lives in Uganda. She is married with eight children, all of whom are in school. Sumiini has a retail shop. She has had this business for less than one year, and works seven days out of every week.  
Sumiini has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the money to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and a bag of maize flour. She also generates income through a restaurant and selling piped water. Her main business challenges include   transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for the business are to start growing sugar cane and also to sell wholesale.    
Sumiini lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and a bag of maize flour.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia lives in Uganda. She is married with six children, all of whom are in school. Olivia has a bakery. She has been in this business for ten years, and works six days out of every week.  
Olivia sells her products door-to-door. Olivia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the money to buy more cartons of baking flour, cowpeas and cooking oil. Her main business challenges include the seasonality of her sales and the ever-increasing price of commodities in Uganda.  
Her goals and aspirations for the business are to own a big bakery and also to improve her standard of living.    
Olivia lives in a home that she rents. She doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more cartons of baking flour, cowpeas and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha lives in Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother). Aisha has a call center. She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days a week. Aisha sells her products retail from home.  Aisha has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy more sim packs and airtime She also generates additional income by selling paw paws. The main business challenges for Aisha include the rainy season which hinders customers from reaching her.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop selling Airtime and Sim packs. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more airtime and sim packs

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).  Madina sells bananas. She has been in this business for 6 years and she works 7 days a week. Madina sells her products retail from home. She has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy bunches of bananas. The main business challenges for Madina include the rainy season which makes rural roads impassable and transportation. Her goals for her business are to own a delivery van, to start selling wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land. Madina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet lives in Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (orphans). Juliet has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for 5 years and she works 7 days a week. Juliet sells her products retail in a shop. Juliet has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO which she will use to buy boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves. The main business challenges for Juliet include the rainy season which hinders customers from reaching her, thieves and transportation. Her business goals are to own a fully stocked salon and to buy a plot of land. Juliet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids

loans.name: Shyr

texts.en:
This is Shyr, 26, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Greg, an Overseas Filipino Worker, and has young children. She is constantly working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Shyr operates a variety store. In the Philippines a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil or an egg. Shyr earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also earns income through Electronic Cellular Phone Loading Station. She buys electronic cellular phone load in huge amounts and then retails it to customers in smaller amounts. Profit depends on the network's dealership policy. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 393 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue business operations, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Shyr dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Touly

texts.fr: L’’emprunteur est un ancien chauffeur de transport interurbain .Il est aujourd’hui âgé de 58 ans. Il est marié et père d’un garçon qui, dés qu’il a obtenu son permis de conduire, a pris sa relève comme chauffeur. L’emprunteur a alors fait une reconversion en s’engageant dans le commerce  d’ustensiles ménagers et de produits vestimentaires. Cette activité lui permet de se prendre en charge et d’aider sa sœur qui vit avec lui. Il vient d’adhérer à l’IMCEC et sollicite un prêt de  150000f pour l’achat de 5 douzaines de baignoires, 07 douzaines de seaux, des sacs et des chaussures dont la vente l’aidera beaucoup dans la satisfaction de ses besoins personnels et de ceux de sa famille. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un magasin de vente en gros d’articles ménagers dans sa localité.
texts.en: The borrower is a former intercity public transport driver. He is now 58 years old. He is married and the father of a boy who, as soon as he got his driver's license, took over as a driver. The borrower then branched out into the business of household products and clothing items. This activity allows him to take care of his family and help out his sister, who lives with him. He just joined IMCEC and is requesting a loan of 150000f to buy 5 dozen tubs, 7 dozen buckets, as well as bags and shoes. The sale will help him much in meeting the needs of his family and his own. His ambition is to open a wholesale store of household products in his community.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen tubs, 7 dozen buckets, as well as bags and shoes.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune homme célibataire qui a arrêté ses études après deux échecs à l'examen de fin d'études primaires.Il s'est ainsi engagé comme apprenti dan la boutique de son oncle pour apprendre le commerce.Il s'installe plus tard à son propre compte avec 350 000F reçus d'une tontine.Aujourd'hui, il propose dans sa cantine au marché central des habits, des chaussures et des bijoux.Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels ainsi que des charges d'alimentation et de paiement de factures d'eau et d'électricité de la famille.Il sollicite un prêt de 400 000F à l'UIMCEC pour l'achat de 200 pièces  d'habits, 100 paires de chaussures et 50 pièces de bijoux.La vente de ces produits l'aidera à mieux participer à l'entretien de sa famille.Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young single man who quit his studies at the end of the primary school cycle after failing the exam twice. His uncle hired him as an apprentice to learn the trade of commerce in his shop. He eventually branched out on his own with a capital of 350,000F received from a tontine (a revolving savings fund).

Nowadays, he has a booth at the central market where he sells clothes, shoes and jewelry. His income allows him to support himself and to help his family with the food, water and electricity bills. 

He is seeking a loan of 400,000F with UIMCEC to purchase 200 pieces of clothing, 100 pairs of shoes, and 50 pieces of jewelry. The sale of this merchandise will allow him to contribute even more to his family’s well-being. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 200 pieces of clothing, 100 pairs of shoes, and 50 pieces of jewelry for resale

loans.name: Mariéme Cisse

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme âgée qui vit seul avec ses 6 enfants depuis le décès de leur père.Elle achète des tissus simples et des thioub(tissus teints)qu'elle place auprès de ses clients et récupère son argent au bout de 2 mois.Elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans après avoir arrête ses voyages de commerce dans les pays de la sous- région faute de bénéfices satisfaisants.Elle sollicite un prêt de 100000F pour acheter des rouleaux de tissus et de "thioub" qu'elle revendra à l'occasion des prochaines fêtes religieuses. Ses bénéfices lui serviront à entretenir ses enfants .
texts.en: The borrower is an elderly woman who has been living alone with her 6 children since the death of their father. She buys regular fabrics as well as thioubs (dyed fabric) which she gives to her customers, and gets paid after two months. She has been doing this for 10 years, after she stopped going on business trips in the subregion, due to a lack of satisfactory profits. She is requesting a loan of 100,000F to buy rolls of fabric and of "thioub," which she will resell during the next religious holidays. The profits will help her take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabrics and of "thioub"

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un ancien marchand ambulant (vente à la sauvette).Il a mené cette activité dans trois grandes villes du pays avant de venir s'implanter dans sa localité actuelle à l'aide d'un premier prêt de 250000f de l'UIMCEC.
