She manages her household while operating the business. She is currently working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joy Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Joy Ann earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual items. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Joy Ann hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to provide the daily needs of her family and give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es: La Sra. Toribia  tiene como actividad la venta D. comida en una D. las  ex trancas que tiene la ciudad D. La paz,  tiene una pequeña  pensión donD.  quedan dos paradas D. minibús a una cuadra queda un  centro D. salud  y  dos cuadras mas arriba queda el reten policial y al frente D. su negocio quedan varios talleres D. reparación  D. automóviles por tal motivo la Sra. Toribia tiene mucha clientela, su esposo trabaja como conductor D. automóvil en una mina aurífera en  los Yungas, actualmente los dos hijos D. los señores ya son mayores D. edad y son independientes, el crédito que  solicito es  para refaccionar el ambiente D. su pensión y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Mrs. Toribia runs a small diner on the outskirts of the city of La Paz.  It is near two minibus stops and not far from a health center, police station and several auto repair shops across the street.  She has many customers.  Her husband works as a driver for a gold mine in Los Yungas.  The couple's two children are adults and live independently.  Toribia is requesting a loan to repair her restaurant and offer her customers better service.

loans.use: To repair her restaurant.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 39 years old and married with three children.

Cheryl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Cheryl has borrowed and paid 25000 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 14 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

Cheryl aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 28 años, es una joven soltera alegre y trabajadora con ganas de triunfar en la vida, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es obtener mejores ingresos para así darle una estabilidad económica a su futura familia. Flor con el apoyo de sus padres abrió una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ella abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar mayores consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es quedar bien con sus clientes, pues lleva 04 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer de pie todo el transcurso del día. En su negocio le va muy bien y gracias a ello apoya en los gastos de alimentación de sus padres. Con el dinero del crédito comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas, pues su mayor deseo es ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar  su  bodega. Este será su primer crédito de Flor y esta muy contenta de saber que contará con el apoyo de todos ustedes para que pueda continuar con su trabajo. Con el crédito comprará mercadería como: sacos de arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en: Flor, 28, is a young, cheerful, hard-working single woman who wants to be successful in life.  She lives in her own home and wants to improve her income so she can give her family a more stable economy.  With the support of her parents, Flor opened a grocery store which offers a variety of basic needs products and generates a good profit.  She opens very early in the morning to receive her first customers.  She says the key to attracting more customers is treating them kindly and helping them with their purchases.  What she enjoys most about her work is keeping the customers satisfied.  She has been in business for four years and feels the hardest part is having to stand all day on the job.  Business is doing well and allows her to help her parents with food costs.  She plans to use the loan to buy bulk quanitities for the store.  Her goal is to add on to the house and expand her store.  This is Flor's first loan and she is happy knowing that she can count on you for help to continue with her work.  She plans to buy merchandise for the store such as sacks of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice, sugar, oils, and detergents to stock her store.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy, aged 38, is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She’s married to Edgardo, her business partner and is the mother of one child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. She is currently working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Joy operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Joy earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling individual items. She also retails rice in her store. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Joy hopes her business grows into a mini-grocery, just as she hopes to provide the daily needs of her family and give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.
